title: Scrum Master Hue Platform
description:
Eindhoven, Netherlands
Category
 Research & Development
Posted Date
 07/30/2024
Job Id
 348727
  
We’re looking for a **Scrum Master** to join our **Hue Connected platform cluster team** in **Eindhoven.**


Working for Signify means being creative and adaptive. Our culture of continuous learning and commitment to diversity and inclusion creates an environment that allows you to build your skills and career. Together, we’re transforming our industry.


As the world leader in lighting, we’re constantly ahead of the curve. Through our leadership in connected lighting and the Internet of Things, we’re breaking new grounds in data analytics, AI, and smart homes, offices, cities and more!


Signify is one of the few companies in the world to achieve carbon neutrality and our next sustainability goals are even bolder: doubling our positive impact on the environment and society by 2025.

  

The Homes&Users teams provide services around accounts, direct2consumer, exploration, and co-creation, and these services are implemented in the Hue cloud and/or in the Hue mobile App.  

The IoT team provides services around device management, software update, remote connectivity, diagnostics & analytics, as well as the platform infrastructure for the cloud and the Hue bridge.  

  

As the Scrum Master of the platform cluster, you coach multiple teams by being a servant leader and supporting them in achieving their goals. You implement and support Agile principles & practices, identify and eliminate impediments, and drive continuous improvement to ensure flow of delivery. You will be working in the Hue R&D development team, alongside other software engineers on one of the largest commercial IoT systems.  

  

We’re on the lookout for forward-thinking innovators with a passion for sustainability. If you match this description, get in touch!

**Your responsibilities**
-------------------------

This position opens a great opportunity for those who wish to contribute to development and further growth of the largest IoT ecosystem in the world:

* You coach people, teams and the organization in agile scrum methodologies and facilitate our scrum rituals to drive continuous improvements.
* You facilitate agile ceremonies such as planning and retrospectives, daily standups, demo sessions for multiple teams in the cluster.
* You remove team impediments with urgency and identify improvements through sprint and PI retrospectives and follow through in implementing these.
* You enable the team to work as a self-empowered unit.
* You know how to unite teams and bring people closer together.
* You are guiding the team in choices on cutting edge technology and development practices and mentors the various teams in these areas.
* You help to get the right insights and improve awareness on value delivery.•You manage and optimize the flow of value using various tools (JIRA).

**Your qualifications**
-----------------------

* You have a Master’s or Bachelor degree and experience in software development (technology, processes, and best practices).
* You have a deep understanding and experience in the Agile development process and methodologies.
* You have minimally 3+ years of experience as a scrum master in a software product development organization.
* You have excellent people skills to lead change in teams and organizations.
* You have experience with servant leadership, and you can convey goal and purpose, while encouraging self-organization.
* You have behavioral competencies such as great business insights, customer-first mentality, cognitive skills, problem-solving skills, being pro-active, emotional intelligence, being clear and candid in your communication, and managing conflicts.
* You have good verbal and written English with excellent communication skills.

title: Cyber Security Engineer
description:
Zuid-Holland
Information Technology
40 uur
MBO
Als teamlid van ons Security Operations Center (SOC) hou je je dagelijks bezig met het verhogen van de digitale weerbaarheid van onze klanten. Of het nu gaat om het monitoren en opvolgen van incidenten, het uitvoeren van een security assessment of het adviseren en implementeren van security-oplossingen voor zowel Cloud als Hybride omgevingen? Jij draait je hand er niet voor om.


Bij deze organisatie zijn ze trots op de relatie met hun klanten. Ze zetten dan ook graag een stap extra voor de klant en zijn zich meer dan bewust dat ze rekenen op de IT & Security expertise. Het is dus goed om te weten dat we iemand zoeken die als specialist op het gebied van (cyber) security graag het verschil maakt in het persoonlijke contact met de klant en actief meedenkt om de weerbaarheid van de klanten naar het hoogst mogelijke niveau te brengen. Ze hebben uitsluitend Rotterdamse klanten, dit komt omdat ze erg van de Rotterdamse mentaliteit houden.


– Je identificeert en analyseert security events en incidenten binnen onze klantomgevingen. Het oplossen pak je zorgvuldig en gestructureerd aan. Je verzorgt de root cause analyse en denkt actief met de klant mee om herhaling te voorkomen.
  

– Je ontleedt gemakkelijk het Cloud of hybride netwerk van de klant zonder belangrijke details te missen. Vervolgens vertaal je de gevonden kwetsbaarheden en bedreigingen zelfstandig naar passende aanbevelingen.  

– Je gebruikt je expertise op het gebied van SIEM, network security en threat analytics om onze playbooks in Microsoft Sentinel te verfijnen. Je denkt ook actief mee aan het uitbouwen van onze Managed Detection & Response dienstverlening.  

– Je beoordeelt opkomende technologieën, trends, kwetsbaarheden en bedreigingen. Samen met het team spar je over de kansen en risico’s. Met deze nieuwe inzichten maak je het verschil voor onze klanten (en de organisatie natuurlijk!).


– Minimaal 3 jaar ervaring als Security Engineer of in een vergelijkbare rol.
  

– MBO werk- en denkniveau. Azure of MS 365 security certificaten zijn een grote pre.
  

– Je hebt kennis van MS 365, KQL, Sentinel en Networking.  

– Je bent 40 uur per week beschikbaar.


– € 2663,- tot € 5589,- op basis van 40 uur en ingeschaald op basis van kennis en kunde.
  

– Leaseauto.  

– Thuiswerkverhouding is 4 dagen op kantoor / 1 dag thuis.
  

– Persoonlijk Keuze Budget om jouw eigen secundaire arbeidsvoorwaarden vorm te geven.  

– Modern kantoor in Maasdijk.
  

– Volop mogelijkheden om certificaten te gaan behalen.

title: Product Owner
description:
**Company Description**  

Hi there, potential colleague! Join us in our mission to become a driver of positive change in the eyewear industry.


Get ready to make a real impact in a certified B Corp as our new **Product Owner.** You will help to define & build a seamless customer experience across all of our digital and physical channels.


Together with UX/UI Designer & Engineers, we will be figuring out what the future of retail in the digital world will be. You will be reporting to the Technical Director and working in a small, international team.


The position is **full-time** and **available immediately** at our headquarters office in **Amsterdam**.

**You'll be...**

* Owning the roadmap for our Unified Commerce pillar with a focus on driving revenue, retention & amazing customer experiences via our sales channels, including eComm & offline storefronts.
* A champion for our customers and understanding their needs when buying eyewear, working closely with the team to identify & research opportunities to improve their experience through the shopping journey.
* Building strong relationships with key stakeholders within the company and partnering with them to identify opportunities and determine the ‘Why’ and ‘What’ so the team can work on the ‘How’.
* Defining & measuring KPIs for each of your projects to measure success and determine the ongoing optimisations needed.
* Comfortable with iterative development, including defining a hypothesis, measuring impact, and learning from previous product releases.
* Communicating clearly with stakeholders on the progress of your roadmap and what the purpose of each project is.
* Managing and grooming the backlog for your team, including writing user stories and determining the order of priority based on business and customer impact.

**You...**

* Have 5+ years of experience working as a Product Owner/Manager within an eComm or SaaS company.
* Can understand the big picture and how to connect the dots but also are able to deliver on the details.
* Are comfortable researching & building cases for new features but also don’t lose sight of continuously improving existing products.
* Take ownership for your work and what your team delivers and are able to learn from the mistakes, as well as celebrating the wins.
* Are not afraid to ask questions and challenge stakeholders and team members to make sure we deliver products that actually help our customers & solve real problems.
* Are able to speak tech with the development team but have no problem distilling complex ideas down to simple terms for the business.
* Are comfortable with data & uncovering insights and have no problem building your own reports in tools like Google Analytics and Looker Studio.
* Are fluent in English Ideally have experience delivering personalised experiences for customers before & after purchase, with a focus on driving loyalty.

**We offer you...**

* Being part of a young and very ambitious team;
* A flexible hybrid work environment
* Personal development opportunities;
* Wellbeing: healthy snacks, a collab with ClassPass and unlimited access to an online-psychologist OpenUp;
* 25 holidays per year (based on full time) plus additional tenure based days;
* Travel reimbursement if you live more than 10kms from our HQ;
* Company pension plan;
* The chance to be involved with every aspect of a rapidly growing company
* Daily nutritious lunch;
* Participation in events planned by our CultureClub (e.g. Borrel XXL, &talks, holiday gifting, ...);
* Continuous updates of your eyewear collection!

*Jeez, that was a lot. Still with us? If you are, and you’re thinking that you might fit this profile, please apply via the form below. We’d love to hear from you!*

*Ace & Tate is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to nurturing an inclusive environment for all current and potential employees.*

 **Additional Information**
company_description: Take another look. We’re out to shake up the industry with bold new perspectives on all-things eyewear. You in?

title: Data Analytics Engineer | Education Analytics
description:
**Jouw functie**
----------------


Ons team Education Analytics heeft als missie de onderwijskwaliteit te verbeteren met behulp van data. Wij vertalen problemen en behoeftes in concrete onderzoeksvragen en adviseren vervolgens het College van Bestuur, management, beleidsmakers en portefeuillehouders. Daarnaast werken we nauw samen met de Chief Data Officer om de datavolwassenheid van de organisatie te verbeteren.


In jouw rol werk je met name aan de architectuur, ontsluiting en preparatie van data, maar denk je óók mee met je teamleden over mogelijke oplossingen voor onderwijsvraagstukken. Omdat we multidisciplinair werken, zul je over de hele breedte van het analytics vak opgeleid worden.


**Jouw taken**


* *samenwerken* met de data scientists in ons team om te bepalen hoe we nieuwe analyses, rapportages en modellen ontwikkelen die de business verder gaan ondersteunen qua sturing en efficienc
* *ontsluiten* van databronnen
* *ontwikkelen* en *onderhouden* van data-architectuur
* *implementeren* en *optimaliseren* van ETL-processen
* *geautomatiseerd testen*: het schrijven van testscripts en het functioneel en technisch uitvoeren van testen


**Jouw profiel**
----------------

* HBO/WO werk- en denkniveau met minimaal A2 taalniveau Nederlands
* tenminste 1 jaar ervaring binnen een soortgelijke organisatie of rol
* aantoonbare kennis en ervaring met R of andere relevante programmeertalen in het datadomein
* je hebt een pro-actieve houding en bent een échte teamspeler
* kennis van / ervaring met versiebeheer
* je bent sneller ingewerkt als je affiniteit hebt met open source ontwikkeling, Docker en agile werkwijzen


Als universiteit streven we naar gelijke kansen voor iedereen, in het besef dat diversiteit vele vormen kent. Wij geloven dat diversiteit in al haar complexiteit van onschatbare waarde is voor de kwaliteit van ons onderwijs, onderzoek en onze dienstverlening. We zijn altijd op zoek naar talent met diverse achtergronden en ervaringen. Dat betekent ook dat we ons inzetten voor het creëren van een inclusieve gemeenschap, zodat we diversiteit als meerwaarde kunnen benutten.


We beseffen dat elk individu een unieke set aan vaardigheden, expertise en denkwijze met zich meebrengt. We nodigen dan ook graag iedereen uit die zich herkent in het profiel om te solliciteren, zelfs als je niet aan alle eisen voldoet.


**Wat bieden wij**
------------------


Een uitdagende functie bij een maatschappelijk betrokken organisatie. Bij de VU draag je bij aan onderwijs, onderzoek en dienstverlening voor een betere wereld. En daar mag wat tegenover staan. Daarom bieden wij jou:


* Een salaris van minimaal € 3.226,00 en maximaal € 5.090,00 (Schaal 10) bruto per maand, bij een voltijds dienstverband. Dit is gebaseerd op het UFO-profiel Medewerker administratieve processen en systemen 2, Medewerker bestuurlijke informatievoorziening 1. Het precieze salaris hangt af van je opleiding en ervaring.
* Een functie voor minstens 0,8 fte. Je arbeidsovereenkomst duurt in eerste instantie 1 jaar. Daarna is er uitzicht op verlenging.


Daarnaast bieden wij je aantrekkelijke secundaire arbeidsvoorwaarden en regelingen. Enkele voorbeelden:


* Bij een voltijdse 38-urige werkweek hoort een vakantietegoed van 232 uur per jaar. Als je ervoor kiest om 40 uur te werken, beschik je op jaarbasis over 96 extra vakantie-uren. Bij een deeltijdaanstelling wordt dit naar rato berekend.
* 8% vakantietoeslag en 8,3% eindejaarsuitkering
* ruimte voor persoonlijke ontwikkeling
* hybride werken maakt een goede werk/privébalans mogelijk
* keuzemodel voor fiscale uitruil van bepaalde arbeidsvoorwaarden


**Over ons**
------------

**Benieuwd met wat voor vraagstukken en data we ons bezighouden?**


Dat snappen we helemaal. Daarom geven we je een aantal voorbeelden:


* We werken veel met studiedata om analyses te kunnen uitvoeren op de voortgang van de studie en of dit verband houdt met bepaald beleid dat we hebben ingevoerd (of kunnen invoeren)
* We voeren de regie op onderwijsevaluaties, zoals de landelijke enquêtes (NSE, NAE, Alumni Monitor) en maken de inzichten toegankelijk via dashboards
* We maken voorspellingen van aanmeldingen en inschrijvingen & uitval en afstudeerders, zodat de planning ruim van tevoren gemaakt kan worden en inefficiëntie beperkt blijft
* We hebben onlangs toegang gekregen tot Canvas (ons Learning Management System). We zijn nu bezig deze data te ontsluiten en op (korte) termijn het aanspreekpunt te zijn over inzichten uit deze leeromgeving


**Welkom bij de dienst Student- & Onderwijszaken**  

Bij de dienst Studenten & Onderwijszaken (SOZ) zorgen we ervoor dat de Vrije Universiteit Amsterdam werkt als een geoliede machine. We dragen bij aan de logistiek en uitvoering van het onderwijs – en aan een zorgeloze en onvergetelijke onderwijservaring voor onze studenten. We ondersteunen studenten van aanmelding tot diplomering. We zorgen ervoor dat internationale studenten en wetenschappers hun weg weten te vinden aan de VU – bijvoorbeeld door huisvesting en andere voorzieningen te regelen. Daarnaast werken we samen met de faculteiten aan onderwijsbeleid en onderwijsverbeteringen. Studeren, groeien én genieten: we zorgen ook voor sport- en cultuuractiviteiten, voor iedereen op de VU-campus en daarbuiten.


Kom je werken bij SOZ? Dan werk je in het hart van de VU. Samen met ruim 350 collega’s in de faculteiten bied je studenten en medewerkers de dienstverlening die past bij de VU: persoonlijk, op maat, van hoge kwaliteit.


**Vrije Universiteit Amsterdam**  

De Vrije Universiteit Amsterdam staat voor waardengedreven onderwijs en onderzoek. Wij zijn vrije denkers met kennis van zaken en een open houding – a broader mind. Met een ondernemende aanpak en aandacht voor diversiteit, zingeving en medemenselijkheid werken wij aan duurzame oplossingen met maatschappelijke impact. Door onze krachten te bundelen, over de grenzen van vakgebieden heen, werken we aan een betere wereld voor mens en planeet. Samen creëren we een veilig en respectvol werk- en studieklimaat, en een inspirerende omgeving voor onderwijs en onderzoek. Lees meer over onze gedragscodes.


We zijn gevestigd op één fysieke campus, in het hart van de Amsterdamse Zuidas, met een uitstekende ligging en bereikbaarheid. Aan de VU werken ruim 6.150 medewerkers en volgen ruim 31.000 studenten wetenschappelijk onderwijs.


**Diversiteit**  

Diversiteit is een speerpunt van de VU. De VU wil toegankelijk en ontvankelijk zijn voor diversiteit in vakgebieden, culturen, ideeën, nationaliteiten, overtuigingen, voorkeuren en levensbeschouwingen. Vanuit vertrouwen, respect en interesse leiden verschillen hier tot nieuwe inzichten en innovatie, tot scherpte en helderheid, tot excellentie en een ruimer begrip.


Wij staan voor een inclusieve gemeenschap en geloven dat diversiteit en internationalisering bijdragen aan de kwaliteit van onderwijs, onderzoek en onze dienstverlening.


We zijn dan ook voortdurend op zoek naar mensen die door hun achtergrond en ervaring bijdragen aan de diversiteit van de VU-gemeenschap.


**Interesse**
-------------


Ben jij geïnteresseerd in deze functie en ben jij van mening dat jouw ervaring bijdraagt aan de kwaliteit van onze dienstverlening? Dan nodigen wij je graag uit om te solliciteren, ook als je niet aan alle eisen voldoet.


Het overleggen van een diploma en een referentiecheck maken onderdeel uit van de sollicitatieprocedure.


*Sollicitaties ontvangen per e-mail worden niet in behandeling genomen.*


*Acquisitie naar aanleiding van deze advertentie wordt niet op prijs gesteld.*

title: Senior Data Analyst - Digital, Assisted & Customer Interactions
description:
*English vacancy text below*

Bij ING streven we ernaar de beste mobiele bank van het continent te worden. De Tribe Digital, Assisted & Customer Interactions is daarbij verantwoordelijk voor het realiseren van de digitale verkoopdoelstellingen en voor het verzorgen en verbeteren van alle digitale interacties met klanten. Daarnaast zorgen we er met meer dan 70 data analisten en data scientists voordat we de transitie naar een volledig data-gedreven organisatie versnellen.

**Jij start binnen ‘Personalisatie’.**

Dit is een analytics team met 4 data analisten en 2 customer journey experts. Samen zorgen zij ervoor dat klanten een gepersonaliseerde beleving in de ING bankieren app hebben. Binnen het team vervul jij een rol die op het snijvlak van data analist en customer journey expert ligt. Je zal het bedrijf ingaan en kansen spotten om met analytics oplossingen, het creëren, onderhouden en aanbieden van digitale personalisatie makkelijker te maken voor je collega’s. Je ziet waar de behoeften van je collega’s liggen, weet die te vertalen naar analytics producten en werkt mee aan de bouw en implementatie daarvan. Daarvoor is nauwe samenwerking met IT en de business cruciaal. Je bent dus ongeveer de helft van je tijd consultancy werkzaamheden aan het doen en de andere helft van je tijd data analisten werk.


Als je je na een paar jaar bij ‘personalisatie’ op een andere plek binnen het bedrijf verder wil ontwikkelen binnen het bedrijf als senior data analist, dan zijn daar volop mogelijkheden voor. We nemen je aan als data analist en je komt daarmee in de poule van 70 data analisten die we uitzenden over het bedrijf.

**Naar wie zijn we op zoek?**

We zijn op zoek naar een door de wol geverfde data analist, met affiniteit met IT, die het leuk vindt om naast het technische werk ook interne consultancy werkzaamheden op te pakken. Je bent een echte innovator en in staat om een paar stappen verder door te denken dan anderen. Je weet structurele analytics oplossingen te bedenken voor complexe problemen en snapt ook hoe je deze ideeën kunt omzetten naar praktische implementatie.

**Als data analist:**

* Heb je een passie voor fact-based werken en beslissingen maken
* Identificeer je nieuwe oplossingen en ideeën om impact te maken met behulp van data en analyses
* Ben je in staat om behoeftes binnen het bedrijf te identificeren en aansluitend hierop nieuwe data producten en analytics oplossingen te bedenken en bouwen
* Weet je als geen ander stakeholder management te bedrijven en anderen mee te krijgen in veranderingen
* Ervaring met Martech of online personalisatie vanuit analytics perspectief is een pré


Heeft data analyse voor jou geen geheimen meer en wil je jezelf verbreden en ontwikkelen door meer consultancy werkzaamheden aan je baan toe te voegen? Dan zijn wij op zoek naar jou!

**Je competenties en ervaring**

* Je hebt een master op het gebied van analytics, wiskunde of econometrie
* Je hebt 10+ jaar ervaring in analytics
* Je hebt ruime ervaring met querytalen (bijvoorbeeld SQL, SAS, Python)
* Je hebt aantoonbare affiniteit met IT en artificiële intelligentie
* Je bent analytisch sterk en hebt ervaring in het maken van complexe analyses
* Je kunt data transformeren in inzichten en deze op een begrijpelijke manier presenteren
* Je hebt een aanpakkersmentaliteit. Je leert graag snel en past nieuwe technieken toe
* Je bent klantgericht
* Je kunt goed omgaan met verschillende type stakeholders bijvoorbeeld mede dataspecialisten, marketeers, engineers of risk collega's.
* Je vraagt actief om hulp en feedback en durft feedback te geven
* Je stelt het belang van het team waarin je werkt boven je eigen belang
* Je spreekt vloeiend Engels. Beheersing van de Nederlandse taal is een plus
* Ervaring met de agile manier van werken is een pré

**Wat bieden wij jou?**

Wij bieden een fulltime 36 uurspositie in een uitdagende omgeving. Je krijgt de kans om bij een moderne agile organisatie te werken met intelligente en leuke collega’s en vele kansen om zowel je technische als persoonlijke competenties verder te ontwikkelen. Elke 3 weken komen we met de 70 data analisten bij elkaar om met en van elkaar te leren

**De voordelen van werken bij ING zijn onder andere:**

* Een uitstekend salaris dat aansluit bij je kwaliteiten en ervaring
* Een werkweek van 36 uur
* 24-27 vakantiedagen afhankelijk van het contract
* Een 13e maand en 8% vakantiegeld
* Bijdrage Individuele besparingen (BIS), 3,5% van je bruto jaarsalaris
* Flexibele werktijden en thuiswerken (hybride modus)
* De mobiliteitskaart. Je kiest je vervoerswijze voor het woon-werkverkeer per dag. Vrijheid en flexibiliteit in mobiliteit.
* Een pensioenplan
* Persoonlijke groeimogelijkheden en uitdagend werk met eindeloze mogelijkheden
* Een informele werkomgeving met diverse groep van innovatieve collega’s


Bekijk hier de ING employee benefits: Benefits | ING

**Ben je enthousiast? Klik dan op de knop Solliciteren**

Laat ons weten waarom jij bent wie wij zoeken: hoe ga je je ervaring gebruiken om ING nog beter te maken? Graag ontvangen wij een CV én motivatiebrief.

**Meer informatie?**

Neem contact op met Jeroen Maassen van den Brink (jeroen.maassen.van.den.brink@ing.com) voor vragen.


ING is looking for a Senior Data Analyst – Digital, Assisted & Customer Interactions

**Who are we?**

At ING, we aim to become the best mobile-led bank on the continent. The Tribe Digital, Assisted & Customer Interactions is responsible for achieving the digital sales objectives and for enhancing all digital interactions with customers. Additionally 70 data analysts and scientists work to accelerate our transition to a fully data-driven organization.


You will join the ‘Personalization’ team which consists of 4 data analysts and 2 customer journey experts. Together, they ensure a personalized experience for customers in the ING banking app. Your role will blend data analysis and customer journey expertise. You will identify opportunities to simplify digital personalization for colleagues using analytics solutions, translating their needs into analytics solutions and collaborating closely with IT and business teams. Your time will be split between consultancy work and data analysis.


After a few years in ‘Personalization, opportunities for further development as a senior data analyst within the company will be available. You will join as a data analyst and be part of the pool of 70 data analysts deployed across the company.

**Who are we looking for?**

We are looking for a seasoned data analyst with an affinity for IT who enjoys combining technical work with internal consultancy tasks. You are an innovator, capable of thinking several steps ahead, devising structural analytics solutions for complex problems, and knowing how to implement these ideas practically.


As a data analyst, you:

* Have a passion for fact-based decision-making.
* Identify new solutions and ideas to create impact using data and analysis.
* Can identify company needs and develop new data products and analytics solutions accordingly.
* Excel in stakeholder management and can drive others to embrace changes.
* Experience with Martech or online personalization from an analytics perspective is a plus.


If data analysis holds no secrets for you and you want to broaden your role by incorporating more consultancy tasks, we are looking for you!

**Your competencies and experience**

* You hold a master's degree in analytics, mathematics, or econometrics.
* You have over 10 years of experience in analytics
* You have ample experience with query languages (e.g., SQL, SAS, Python)
* You have demonstrated affinity with IT and artificial intelligence.
* You possess strong analytical skills and experience in conducting complex analyses.
* You can transform data into insights and present them clearly.
* You have a proactive attitude, learn quickly, and apply new techniques.
* You are customer-oriented.
* You are adept at interacting with various stakeholders, such as fellow data specialists, marketers, engineers, or risk colleagues.
* You actively seek help and feedback and are willing to give feedback.
* You prioritize the interests of your team over your own.
* You are fluent in English; proficiency in Dutch is a plus.

**What do we offer you?**

We offer a full-time 36-hour position in a challenging environment. You will have a chance to work at a modern Agile organization with smart and fun colleagues and great opportunities to develop both your technical and personal competencies.

**The benefits of working at ING include:**

* An excellent salary that matches your qualities and experience
* A 36-hour working week
* 24-27 vacation days depending on the contract
* A 13th month and 8% holiday allowance
* Contribution Individual Savings (BIS), 3.5% of your gross annual salary
* Flexible working hours and working from home (hybrid mode)
* The Mobility Card. You choose your mode of transport for commuting per day. Freedom and flexibility in mobility.
* A pension plan
* Personal growth opportunities and challenging work with endless possibilities
* An informal working environment with a diverse group of innovative colleagues


 See here the ING employee benefits: Benefits | ING

**Are you excited? Then click on the apply button**

Let us know why you are who we are looking for: how will you use your experience to make ING even better? We would like to receive your CV and motivation letter.

**More information?**

Please contact Jeroen Maassen van den Brink (jeroen.maassen.van.den.brink@ing.com) for your questions.
company_description: With 9 million account holders, ING is one of the largest and most prominent financial service providers in the Netherlands. We are part of ING Group, a global financial institution.
ceo_name: Steven van Rijswijk, CEO ING Group

title: Solution Architect Model Data Factory
description:
**Solution Architect Model Data Factory**  

DLL is not your average financial services company. In fact, we are above average in almost every way. With an employee engagement score of 85% (compared to the 72% industry average), it sure seems like we are doing something right. And, while most companies survive fewer than 20 years, 2019 marked our 50th.



We collaborate with manufacturers, suppliers, and businesses in more than 30 countries to enable the acquisition of equipment, technology and software that companies need to contribute meaningfully to their communities. We believe in partnering with our customers to develop innovative and sustainable financial solutions that deliver meaningful value to the world.



At DLL, we are committed to making sure that all people, regardless of their race, ethnicity, gender, sexual orientation, age, religion, physical characteristics, or mental abilities, feel welcomed and encouraged to be their authentic selves. We strive to create an inclusive environment that is reflective of the communities in which we operate. Come see what all the excitement is about.



As a **Solution Architect**, you will work for a global solution, with a strong focus on the Model Data Factory, in the Risk Enterprise Business Solution Delivery Team and are responsible for the architecture of this solution in the domain. The collection and preparation of model data will be implemented via a new solution called (MDF) and will replace existing model data solutions. The MDF is the primary and single provider of Model Data for any of the Model lifecycle phases. Model data inside the MDF will exist at different quality levels. The data will traverse through the MDF to achieve higher quality and usability.



In the MDF data is prepared in such a way it can be used in the different phases of the model lifecycle. This means that if data is not yet up to the standard that model management needs, this is the solution to enhance the data according well governed business rules.



You will work closely with Group Analytics and departments like Data Management and Risk. You collect business requirements and translate this into process, application, information and infrastructure designs together with the solution design teams and document this in the Solution Vision (i.e. Project Start Architecture) . You guide development teams in realizing the solutions providing architectural direction. You are responsible for documenting the architecture baseline in the architecture repository. You are responsible that the solution complies with various regulatory requirements and monitor the realization of these.



Find out more here about how you can unleash your full potential at DLL

 **Day to day:**  

* Alignment with business stakeholders to understand requirements, design business processes and translate these to IT solutions covering application, information and infrastructure architecture.
* Organize solution Design activities and involve the right stakeholders.
* Design solutions based on the business requirements and assured these are within architectural boundaries.
* Capture the solution direction in the Solution Vision
* Arrange approval for architecture artifacts with business stakeholders, lead architect, architects of other domains and delivery teams
* Participate in the solution design authority to ensure that the MDF solution fits into the end-to-end solution that's needed for Group Analytics.
* Provide support, give overview and guidance in the specific business domain regarding preconditions for successful adoption of changes / new technology by coaching and supporting business and IT to deploy solutions.
* Work closely with the Lead architect and co-create architecture roadmaps and an architecture plan in line with the business strategy.
* Monitor the execution of the architecture roadmaps by maintaining and coordinating the architecture backlog of the global solution.
* Ensure the architecture repository for the global solution is always up to date.
* Provide architectural guidance to Agile Engineers.
* Monitor implementation of solutions to ensure they are according to Solution Visions
* Proactively come up with ideas to improve the IT landscape within the global solution.
* Keep abreast with new or changing insights, architecture practices, technology and the relevant developments in the IT and financial services markets.


**All members enjoy**

* Two working days per year volunteering for a local charity.
* Health and Wellness program including healthy food, free health checks, fun health & vitality activities.
* Flexible hours with possibility to work from home
* Career development opportunities: online learning, member development programs.


“We lead the way in meeting the need for flexibility and transparency which our customers increasingly expect”

 **Essentials:**  

* 5 years of experience architecting IT solutions, preferably in Data Management.
* Experience in working in Agile/scrum environments in the IT sector and financial services.
* University Level Education.
* Practical experience with architecture frameworks.
* Excellent communicator in speech and writing.
* Customer Oriented.
* Leadership skills.
* Stakeholder Management Skills (networker).
* Ability to coach Agile Engineers.
* Focus on Delivery.
* Able to convey IT subjects in business terminology
* Experience with Microsoft Azure- and Databricks based solutions (i.e. ‘medallion’ architecture)


**Extras:**


* Certified for TOGAF.
* Certified for Archimate (using Bizzdesign).
* Sound Technology background in a Data Management environment.
* Sound understanding of Architecture Concepts.
* Understand/knows relevant business processes related with Banking and Risk/Modeling or can learn them quickly.
* Experience in Agile environments.
* Experience in Software Development Methodologies

 **Choose wellbeing**  

DLL’s wellbeing ambition is to educate, equip and empower members to build connections, manage their mental, emotional, physical and financial wellness and maintain balance between work and the other priorities that make up their lives.



Our four wellbeing categories are as follows:


* Connection – Build meaningful connections with other DLL members
* Health – Manage mental, emotional and physical health
* Finance – Provide learning opportunities to help members achieve personal financial health
* Lifestyle – Maintain balance between work and life priorities


These are the things that matter to our members and the wellbeing of our members matters to DLL

 **Settling in**  

At DLL, we are many things. We are team members, family members, community member. We are members of society, members of different cultures and nationalities. Members of change. We each have different beliefs, different passions, different viewpoints, talents and interests. We come from different backgrounds, cultures, nationalities and histories.



But for all of our differences, we share one thing in common: each of us are members of DLL.



Our company was founded in the Netherlands. But today we are truly a multinational business. Our unique culture is rooted in higher collaboration, less hierarchy and an honest directness that enable us to integrate, ideate and innovate across country lines.



Many companies say they are European, American, Asian or Australian, at DLL we are all these places and more.



We are a cross-culture collaborative – an interconnected network – that comes together every single day with one goal in mind: **Partnering for a better world.**

 **Good to know:**  

* Deadline for application: August 25th (Due to high volume of applications this requisition may close prior to posted close date)
* The selection process may involve an assessment.
* Applications via email will not be reviewed. Please apply online via our career website.
* DLL’s referral program applies
* For more information, please contact our Talent acquisition partner Omnia Hassan via omnia.hassan@dllgroup.com


DLL appreciates the time you spend applying to our openings. We advise only those who qualify for an interview will be contacted. Hiring subject to successful completion of a background check.



DLL is an equal opportunity employer. We are committed to inclusive, barrier-free recruitment and selection processes and work environments. If contacted for an employment opportunity, please advise Human Resources if you require accommodation in accordance with our values and all applicable legislation.

title: Machine Learning Engineer Future Model Landscape
description:
**Machine Learning Engineer Future Model Landscape**  

As a Machine Learning Engineer, you will be the linking pin between the business and IT development. You optimize the (ML) Model workflow in DLL, development and deployment, with a platform approach. We are looking at automating the entire Model Lifecycle as much as possible. That we intend to set up self service onboarding of new models, where the intention is to have the least amount of IT involvement as possible. Also, we need to provide a stable platform, which can serve models in a secure/regulatory compliant way. You will work closely with Data Management and departments like Group Analytics, and Risk. The platforms are the Model Lifecycle and Model Execution Platforms.



Find out more here about how you can unleash your full potential at DLL

 **Day to day:**  

* Gathering business and functional data requirements
* Be a sparring partner for product owners and other stakeholders
* Create solution designs and data models, with your team and in alignment with architectural guidelines
* Create designs and ensure solutions are built according to the designs and guidelines
* As a team player help out where needed to get the job done
* Create User Stories in close alignment with team and stakeholders
* Embedding IT requirements, security, compliance and non-functional requirements – and taking into account architecture landscape and target state.
* Be involved in System Test and UAT, check whether built solution fulfills acceptance criteria from a technical perspective
* Organize test activities/ events and follow-up on findings, following DLL policy regarding testing
* Ensures that deliveries by the team is supported with proper documentation.


**All members enjoy**

“We lead the way in meeting the need for flexibility and transparency which our customers increasingly expect”

* We are not looking for a Data Scientist or a Data Engineer, the position is related to the ML Ops part of the model lifecycle
* 3+ years of hands-on experience designing and implementing Azure-based systems. Experience with Azure, Databricks, CI/CD, MLOps, Automation

These are the things that matter to our members and the wellbeing of our members matters to DLL

 **Settling in**  

At DLL, we are many things. We are team members, family members, community member. We are members of society, members of different cultures and nationalities. Members of change. We each have different beliefs, different passions, different viewpoints, talents and interests. We come from different backgrounds, cultures, nationalities and histories.



But for all of our differences, we share one thing in common: each of us are members of DLL.



Our company was founded in the Netherlands. But today we are truly a multinational business. Our unique culture is rooted in higher collaboration, less hierarchy and an honest directness that enable us to integrate, ideate and innovate across country lines.

title: Diabeter Principal IT Business Analyst/Product Owner
description:
At Medtronic you can begin a life-long career of exploration and innovation, while helping champion healthcare access and equity for all. You’ll lead with purpose, breaking down barriers to innovation in a more connected, compassionate world.
A Day in the Life
As a Diabeter Principal IT Business Analyst/Product Owner you will play a pivotal role in the development and continuous improvement of the CloudCare platform. You will bridge the gap between business needs and technical solutions, ensuring that CloudCare meets the requirements of both patients and healthcare providers.
Responsibilities may include the following and other duties may be assigned.* Requirements Gathering: Collaborate with stakeholders (patients, healthcare providers, internal teams) to gather and document detailed business and functional requirements.
* Product Vision: Develop and maintain a clear product vision and roadmap for CloudCare, aligning with Diabeter’s strategic goals.
* Backlog Management: Create, prioritize, and manage the product backlog, ensuring that the development team is focused on delivering the most valuable features.
* User Stories: Write clear and concise user stories with acceptance criteria to guide the development process.
* Stakeholder Communication: Act as the main point of contact for stakeholders, providing regular updates on product progress and gathering feedback for continuous improvement.
* Data Analysis: Utilize data analytics tools to monitor product performance and make data-driven decisions to enhance user experience and functionality.
* Quality Assurance: Work closely with the QA team to ensure that new features and enhancements meet quality standards and user expectations.
* Project Management: Oversee the project lifecycle, from planning and development to testing and deployment, ensuring timely delivery of features.
* Market Research: Stay informed about industry trends, competitor products, and emerging technologies to inform product development.


Required Knowledge and Experience:* Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field.
* 5+ years of experience in a Business Analyst or Product Owner role, preferably in the healthcare or technology sector.
* Strong understanding of diabetes management and related technologies is a plus.
* Proven experience with Agile/Scrum methodologies.
* Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and decision-making skills.
* Proficiency in using project management and data analysis tools (e.g., JIRA, Confluence, Tableau, SQL).
* Knowledge of healthcare interoperability standards (e.g., HL7 FHIR) and data security regulations (e.g., HIPAA) is highly desirable.
* Experience with MDR CE-marking and understanding of regulatory requirements for Software as a Medical Device (SaMD).


What we offer:* Flexible working environment
* Annual Incentive Plan % depending on company results
* Pension scheme and group discount on healthcare insurance
* Training possibilities via Cornerstone/Skills Lab
* Employee Assistance Program and Recognize! (our global recognition program)


Physical Job Requirements  

  

The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by employees assigned to this position, but they are not an exhaustive list of all the required responsibilities and skills of this position.
Benefits & Compensation
Medtronic offers a competitive Salary and flexible Benefits Package  

A commitment to our employees lives at the core of our values. We recognize their contributions. They share in the success they help to create. We offer a wide range of benefits, resources, and competitive compensation plans designed to support you at every career and life stage.  

About Medtronic
We lead global healthcare technology and boldly attack the most challenging health problems facing humanity by searching out and finding solutions.  

Our Mission — to alleviate pain, restore health, and extend life — unites a global team of 90,000+ passionate people.  

We are engineers at heart— putting ambitious ideas to work to generate real solutions for real people. From the R&D lab, to the factory floor, to the conference room, every one of us experiments, creates, builds, improves and solves. We have the talent, diverse perspectives, and guts to engineer the extraordinary.
Learn more about our business, mission, and our commitment to diversity here
company_description: CAREERS THAT CHANGE LIVES Do meaningful work, make a difference, and improve lives.

title: Product Manager, Data
description:
**The Position**



We are looking for an inspiring and analytical Product Manager Data to join Sympower's Product team and challenge us on building the right thing to help our customers accelerate the global transition towards 'net zero' with smarter and cleaner renewable energy systems.

  


You'll be collaborating with 10 other Product Managers and designers and leading, alongside an engineering team-lead, a team of 6 engineers to deliver impactful outcomes.

 *This is a full-time position remote/hybrid located in -1/+1 to central European timezone.*

 **What is in it for you**



We are committed to creating an inclusive and values-based culture where everyone feels that they belong and where everyone has the opportunity to do meaningful work.



We offer a market competitive compensation package, including but not limited to:

  

* 30 Days Paid Holiday Leave
* 1 Day Paid Wellness Leave
* 1 Day Paid Birthday Leave
* Paid Maternity and Partner Leave
* Pawternity Leave
* Mental Health and Wellbeing Support
* Remote Office Budget
* Internet Allowance
* Development Plan & Budget
* Stock Appreciation Rights
* 2 Days Paid Volunteer Leave



Learn about all of our benefits on our careers page.

  

As a Product Manager Data at Sympower, you'll play a pivotal role in leveraging data to drive the creation of new features, enhance the platform's value, and elevate the overall customer/user experience. Your primary focus will be on Data Analytics, where you'll work to build upon the existing foundation of the Data Platform, self-service data solutions, and BI dashboards. Given Sympower's current growth phase, it's crucial to empower our customers with insights on their performances, Second to that you will also empower internal teams to derive insights from accessible data. This presents an opportunity for you to make a significant impact within the organization, contributing to Sympower's evolution into a mature, data-driven entity.

 **What you will do**



Your role will be focused on three key areas: strategy, execution, and user understanding. This means you'll play a crucial part in shaping the direction of our data products, ensuring their successful implementation, and deeply understanding the needs and experiences of our users.  



  

**Strategy**


* Develop a strategy for maximizing the value of data as an independent product
* Drive the self-service analytics & data-informed decision-making throughout the company
* Ask insightful questions to determine the “what” and the “why” of our priorities
* Co-create and define the Product Roadmap alongside the other Product Managers
* Provide context and guidance, empowering your team to have impactful results
* Improve the visibility and positioning of the product team in the company


**Execution**


* Prioritise product outcome and capabilities based on research and data analysis
* Set goals, define success metrics and motivate your team to achieve
* Own team backlog & fulfilment, collaborate closely with the engineering team lead
* Align stakeholders around the product outcomes


**User understanding**


* Conduct customer, competitor, and market research to inform strategic decisions
* Define behavioural questions, set the right analytics tool, measure, learn and adjust
* Work with a Product designer on various user science techniques to understand deeply your end users

 **What you will need**

  

* 4 years’ experience as a product manager (and working directly with a team of Analytical/Data engineers)
* Strong analytical skills
* Curiosity fuels your working day, and data drives your decision-making process
* Collaborative mind-set, with experience in stakeholder engagement and excellent communication skills
* Hands-on and result-oriented focus
* Proven ability of developing and managing complex software products with your team
* Experience working with agile methodologies
* Proven experience of pro-active behaviour and contributing to the development of the product team culture
* *This is a full-time position remote/hybrid located in -1/+1 to central European timezone.*

 **Beneficial skills**

  

* Experience with (BI) reports, dashboards, and visualisations, preferably with PowerBI and Databricks.
* Experience with ELT data pipeline development, preferably with SQL and Python (Spark)
* Hands-on experience within the data domain (e.g. data pipeline development)
* Proven ability to go from raw data to information, create conclusions and suggest actions
* Experience with planning roadmap initiatives using the Double Diamond framework and prioritising them using various frameworks (weighted score, RICE, etc.) in product management tools such as Productboard, Airfocus, etc.
* Interest in user science techniques such as survey, interview, prototyping, A/B testing, analytics tools
* Proficiency in empowering internal teams and/or external developers through your services/products.
* Experience within the energy industry

 **Who we are**



Sympower is accelerating the global transition towards ‘net-zero’ by helping to build smarter, cleaner renewable energy systems. Using our proprietary software platform, we help balance the supply and demand of electricity across international energy networks.



We help businesses, grid operators, asset owners and other energy stakeholders around the world reduce their carbon emissions, integrate more distributed renewable energy resources, and generate new revenue streams by participating in demand-side response services.

  


Learn more about us in this video.

  

In 2022, Sympower became a certified B Corp, which shows the company is meeting high standards of verified performance, accountability, and transparency across 5 impact areas: governance, workers, community, environment, and customers.

 *Sympower is an equal opportunity employer. We encourage a diverse workforce and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all team members.*


*Your personal data will be processed in accordance with our* *Privacy Policy**.*  

**MESSAGE TO RECRUITMENT AGENCIES: support for filling this position is not required, so proposals for recruitment services will not be reviewed or responded to.**
company_description: Sympower is a cleantech scaleup driven by the mission of shaping an intelligent and green power system via advanced flexibility software solutions that enhance the value of energy assets.

title: PhD Positions Developing Digital Twin Capabilities for the Dutch Electricity Transmission System
description:
PhD Positions Developing Digital Twin Capabilities for the Dutch Electricity Transmission System
 Apply Now
Developing Digital Twin Capabilities for the Dutch Electricity Transmission System.


Job description


TenneTwin project in collaboration with TenneT TSO in The Netherlands aims to develop the digital twin foundation for the Dutch electricity transmission system by applying digitalization, unlocking an unprecedented level of transparency. This enables optimal operation, maintenance, upgrading, and expansion of the power grid to match with the government and TenneT Target Grid 2045 ambitions.



Within the TenneTwin project, TU Delft is hiring two doctoral candidates on the subject: "Developing Digital Twin Capabilities for the Dutch Electricity Transmission System". You will develop a digital twin of the Dutch power grid to better utilise the electricity transmission system, ensure system stability and resilience, and help transmission system operators and policymakers make informed decisions. The research questions answered in TenneTwin project are (1) how to model the TenneT power system to suit the needs of the digital twin, (2) how to determine the sufficient modelling details and verify the model accuracy, (3) how to tune the model parameters to continuously match them with present reality, and (4) how to detect the actual power grid state in sufficient details and update the digital twin model to run simulations and advanced grid analytics?



Tackling these scientific questions requires a multi-disciplinary approach combining knowledge in electrical power systems and information and communication technologies, and excellent software coding skills.



PhD-1 focuses on modelling, version control, and simulation. This includes:



* Investigate modelling, simulation, and related data needs of the digital twin


* Model and simulate various (cross-domain) systems that are part of the digital twin in an effective and comprehensive way, preferably using one solver engine for all


* Develop mechanisms for the model initialisation, e.g., combined power system, communication, and market models, in different operating conditions



PhD-2 focuses on data sources, model adaptiveness and parameter tuning. This includes:



* Investigate the systems’ data needs to suit the purpose of the digital twin for continuous mirroring


* Develop mechanisms to detect and mirror actual systems’ conditions to their digital model counterparts


* Develop mechanisms to fine-tune the digital model parameters based on actual systems' data


* Explore cross-domain sub-system interactions and interdependencies through sensitivity analysis using simulations



We offer four-year PhD appointments, with an anticipated start date in November 2024.



You will be a member of the section Intelligent Electrical Power Grids, in Electrical Sustainable Energy (ESE) Department, Faculty of Electrical Engineering, Mathematics, and Computer Science at TU Delft.



The active participation of TenneT in the TenneTwin project includes industrial supervision of the PhD researchers and facilitating that 80% of the research will be conducted at TenneT’s premises in Arnhem.



About the department



The research in ESE Department is inspired by the technical, scientific, and societal challenges originating from the transition towards a more sustainable society and focuses on four areas:


* DC Systems, Energy Conversion and Storage
* Photovoltaic Materials and Devices
* Intelligent Electrical Power Grids (IEPG)
* High Voltage Technologies


IEPG group, headed by Professor Peter Palensky, works on the future of our power system. The goal is to generate, transmit and use electrical energy in a highly reliable, efficient, stable, clean, affordable, and safe way.


Requirements


Essential job requirements:


* Demonstrable interest in interdisciplinary and intersectoral research, and specifically the interface between power systems and information and communication technologies.
* Completed a Master's and Bachelor’s degree in a highly quantitative and analytical discipline (electrical engineering with an emphasis on power systems, applied mathematics, and/or computer science).
* Excellent academic record (grades of B or higher).
* Excellent analytical and writing skills.
* Very good command of English. The minimum requirement of a TOEFL overall band score of 100 (with scores of at least 21 for all sections) or IELTS overall band score of 7.0 (with scores of at least 6.5 for all sections: writing, reading, listening, speaking) applies to all candidates wanting to pursue a PhD at TU Delft.
* Ability to read and critically analyse power systems / computer science / mathematics papers.
* Strong knowledge of power system modelling, operation, stability and control.
* Strong knowledge of mathematics including differential algebraic equations, discrete systems, and probability theory and statistics.
* You enjoy performing research. You are independent, self-motivated, and eager to learn.
* You are keen to work with industry partners to link real-world challenges to fundamental research questions.
* Demonstrable experience with computer modelling and simulation.
* You enjoy programming and hold your code to a high standard.


Desirables:


* Knowledge of information and communication technologies.
* Experience with Python programming.
* Experience with collaborative software development (e.g. open source).


Doing a PhD at TU Delft requires English proficiency at a certain level to ensure that the candidate is able to communicate and interact well, participate in English-taught Doctoral Education courses, and write scientific articles and a final thesis. For more details please check the Graduate Schools Admission Requirements.


Conditions of employment


Doctoral candidates will be offered a 4-year period of employment in principle, but in the form of 2 employment contracts. An initial 1,5 year contract with an official go/no go progress assessment within 15 months. Followed by an additional contract for the remaining 2,5 years assuming everything goes well and performance requirements are met.



Salary and benefits are in accordance with the Collective Labour Agreement for Dutch Universities, increasing from € 2770 per month in the first year to € 3539 in the fourth year. As a PhD candidate you will be enrolled in the TU Delft Graduate School. The TU Delft Graduate School provides an inspiring research environment with an excellent team of supervisors, academic staff and a mentor. The Doctoral Education Programme is aimed at developing your transferable, discipline-related and research skills.



The TU Delft offers a customisable compensation package, discounts on health insurance, and a monthly work costs contribution. Flexible work schedules can be arranged.



For international applicants, TU Delft has the Coming to Delft Service. This service provides information for new international employees to help you prepare the relocation and to settle in the Netherlands. The Coming to Delft Service offers a Dual Career Programme for partners and they organise events to expand your (social) network.


TU Delft (Delft University of Technology)


Delft University of Technology is built on strong foundations. As creators of the world-famous Dutch waterworks and pioneers in biotech, TU Delft is a top international university combining science, engineering and design. It delivers world class results in education, research and innovation to address challenges in the areas of energy, climate, mobility, health and digital society. For generations, our engineers have proven to be entrepreneurial problem-solvers, both in business and in a social context.



At TU Delft we embrace diversity as one of our core values and we actively engage to be a university where you feel at home and can flourish. We value different perspectives and qualities. We believe this makes our work more innovative, the TU Delft community more vibrant and the world more just. Together, we imagine, invent and create solutions using technology to have a positive impact on a global scale. That is why we invite you to apply. Your application will receive fair consideration.



Challenge. Change. Impact!


Faculty Electrical Engineering, Mathematics and Computer Science


The Faculty of Electrical Engineering, Mathematics and Computer Science (EEMCS) brings together three scientific disciplines. Combined, they reinforce each other and are the driving force behind the technology we all use in our daily lives. Technology such as the electricity grid, which our faculty is helping to make completely sustainable and future-proof. At the same time, we are developing the chips and sensors of the future, whilst also setting the foundations for the software technologies to run on this new generation of equipment – which of course includes AI. Meanwhile we are pushing the limits of applied mathematics, for example mapping out disease processes using single cell data, and using mathematics to simulate gigantic ash plumes after a volcanic eruption. In other words: there is plenty of room at the faculty for ground-breaking research. We educate innovative engineers and have excellent labs and facilities that underline our strong international position. In total, more than 1000 employees and 4,000 students work and study in this innovative environment.



Click here to go to the website of the Faculty of Electrical Engineering, Mathematics and Computer Science.


Additional information


You will be jointly supervised by Dr. Alex Stefanov (Associate Professor), Dr. Jose Rueda Torres (Associate Professor) and Prof. Peter Palensky (head of IEPG group). The industrial supervision is provided by TenneT. The PhD candidates will be located at TenneT's premisses 4 days per week and at TU Delft 1 day per week.



You will benefit from extensive training in technical and transferrable skills. You will be expected to assist in teaching activities (student supervision, labs) related to your subject area.



You will have access to excellent research facilities including the RTDS infrastructure, digital substation, cyber-physical system simulators and Control Room of the Future (CRoF).



The anticipated PhDs start dates is between 1 November 2024 and 15 December 2024.



For more information about this vacancy, please contact Dr. Alex Stefanov (a.i.stefanov@tudelft.nl).


Application procedure


Are you interested in this vacancy? Please apply before **August 31, 2024.**



The applications for this post should be submitted through the application button in the recruitment system.



Please submit: (1) Application letter addressed to Dr. Alex Stefanov that explains your personal motivation in pursuing a PhD and fit to the job requirements, (2) curriculum vitae (CV) with a list of (academic and/or industry) references that we can contact, and (3) qualification evidence including MSc and BSc degrees and transcripts.


* Incomplete applications will not be considered.
* A pre-employment screening can be part of the selection procedure.
* You can apply online. We will not process applications sent by email and/or post.
* Please do not contact us for unsolicited services.


FACULTY/DEPARTMENT### **Faculty of Electrical Engineering, Mathematics & Computer Science**

JOB TYPE### **PhD**

SCIENTIFIC FIELD### **Engineering**

HOURS PER WEEK### **36-40**

SALARY### **€ 2.770,00 - € 3.539,00**

DESIRED LEVEL OF EDUCATION### **University graduate**

VACANCY NUMBER### **TUD05629**


Apply Now

title: Data Engineer consultant - Risk and Regulatory Reporting
description:
Our aim is to support our clients incorporating changes and innovations in valuation, risk and compliance. We share the ambition to contribute to a sustainable and resilient financial system and facing these extraordinary challenges is what drives us every day. Our people are empowered to design and implement efficient and pragmatic solutions. Acting as one team with our partners and clients, we bring a distinctive mix of financial and technological know-how. This unique blend of expertise, team spirit and fairness has contributed to more than 35 years of successful projects and trustful relationships.
  

  

At Finalyse, we believe that each member is unique and that diversity enriches us in many ways. We strive for an inclusive working environment that pursues mutual respect for each other's beliefs and backgrounds.
  

  

**THE ROLE**
  

  

In an increasingly complex regulatory environment and financial world, shaping state-of-the-art reporting capability and data intelligence is essential to bank's core business and financial stability. Finalyse embraces this evolution and is committed to maintain a cutting-edge approach in its Data Management Advisory services.
  

  

We are looking for a highly skilled and motivated Data Engineer/Risk Data Analyst to join our team.
  

  

You will be working on vital and massive finance and risk datasets, designing and building automated, reliable data aggregation solutions to fulfill management and regulatory reporting needs in the banking industry. In this role, you will have a direct impact on bank's internal and external stakeholders.
  

  

The ideal candidate will have a strong understanding of risk calculation and reporting and will be able to build data infrastructure that not only meets architectural and data quality standards but, most of all, business requirements that are meaningful for risk managers.
  

  

**RESPONSIBILITIES**
  

  

You participate to/or lead engagements of our Risk Advisory practice for banking and insurance clients to help them build and maintain their data infrastructure for risk and regulatory reporting. As a Data Engineer, you:
* will work closely with clients to understand business requirements and help them implement risk data and reporting solutions that are fit-for-purpose, ensuring a straight-through-processing and compliance with regulatory standards, including BCBS 239,
* can deep dive into details and investigate reconciliation issues with other reporting systems, such as accounting systems or other source systems,
* will advise our clients on how to implement governance policies and procedures,
* can develop and maintain documentation for all data-related processes, including data lineage, data dictionary, and metadata,
* will stay up-to-date with the latest trends and technologies in the field of data infrastructure and data governance and implement them where applicable.

**MUST-HAVE REQUIREMENTS**
* You have an MA or MSc in management sciences, applied economics or computer sciences.
* At least 5 years of experience in data engineering within financial institutions or a related field, with a strong understanding of banking business and financial products.
* You have outstanding analytical skills.
* You are proficient in SQL, SAS or Python or other programming languages.
* You are familiar with BCBS 239 and its requirements for data governance, data quality, and risk management.
* You are able to act as a bridge between business and IT stakeholders.
* You are able to work autonomously in a result-oriented environment.
* You are fluent in English and Dutch (both verbal and written) and have strong presentation skills.

**NICE TO HAVE**
* Knowledge of data modeling methodologies and techniques for data warehouses and data marts.
* Proficiency in data modeling and management tools such as PowerDesigner, Visio and Collibra.
* Understanding of risk calculation (especially credit risk) and reporting processes.
* Knowledge of European risk regulation (CRR2, CRR3, Basel IV).
* First-hand experience with Agile ways of working is a plus.

**OUR OFFER**
* The opportunity to join a diverse, multinational, dynamic team of talented and passionate individuals with a broad range of analytical and technical skills.
* An excellent working environment with a space for defining your own specialization and career within our flat and flexible structure.
* The opportunity to take initiatives and responsibilities quickly in a fast growing company.
* Extensive training programs adapted to your personal needs, both on technical matters as well as on softs skills.
* Coaching and mentoring by more experienced colleagues.
* Flexible working arrangements - remote/hybrid work mode and 9/10 or 4/5 possible time schedules.
* Attractive remuneration package and extra-legal benefits (health insurance, pension benefits, mobility package, etc.)
* Travel opportunities inside European countries.

title: MLOps Engineer
description:
Summary:  


Do you enjoy working on modern data architecture, designing solutions and making sure these solutions are implemented? If so, we are looking for you!  

Job Description:  

What will you do?
NIBC is seeking a skilled and motivated MLOps Engineer to join our growing team. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in MLOps practices, experience with data science, and proficiency in Databricks and AzureML. As an MLOps Engineer, you will be responsible for the deployment, automation, and maintenance of machine learning models, ensuring their integration within the platform and operational efficiency.
If you are a proactive and detail-oriented MLOps Engineer with a passion for data science and experience in the risk domain or banking sector, we would love to hear from you. Apply today to join our team and help us drive the future of data-driven decision-making.
Key Responsibilities:* Deploy, automate, and maintain ML models using Databricks and AzureML.
* Collaborate with data scientists to ensure models are production-ready and meet performance standards.
* Develop and maintain GUI applications using tools like Streamlit to facilitate model interaction and visualization.
* Implement best practices in MLOps, ensuring models are scalable, reliable, and easy to monitor.
* Work closely with cross-functional teams, including risk domain experts and banking professionals, to understand and address their needs.
* Communicate effectively with team members and stakeholders, ensuring transparency and collaboration throughout the project lifecycle.
* Maintain meticulous documentation of processes, configurations, and workflows.


Your team
We created the data & analytics team to enable our business to deliver high quality data products using a modern cloud data platform. The mission of this technology driven department is to ensure
that data can be sourced, ingested, integrated, and consumed through well designed, automated, and simple to use services and frameworks. The advanced analytics team is an agile team that works in close cooperation with the domain data teams (risk, retail bank, corporate bank, regulatory and finance). The core capabilities that need to be developed include Machine Learning and Monitoring. These capabilities should be metadata driven and tightly integrated with the Governance framework.
NIBC as an IT employer
NIBC IT consists out of several domains and together NIBC IT aims to be one of the driving forces behind the digital transformation of our bank, an ongoing process that will profoundly change the relationship with our clients and the way we do business. We are closely connected and have short lines of communication. If you have a good idea today, you may be elaborating it tomorrow. IT is forever changing and so is NIBC and in order for us to be able to keep on changing, we need sophisticated individuals to help us lead the bank into the future.
NIBC as organisation
Founded in 1945 to finance the visionary entrepreneurs who helped rebuilding the Netherlands after the second World War, NIBC was closely collaborating while professionally supporting companies and individuals in realizing their dreams and goals with a sustainable future in mind. As a multicultural midsize bank with a working environment that is best described as dynamic and ambitious, we share a forward-thinking, can-do attitude with our employees and clients which we call our THINK YES mentality. Our corporate values are Professional, Adaptive, Collaborative and Entrepreneurial. You will have a direct and meaningful impact on both the bank and its clients. By building our company on optimism and mutual trust, and with our THINK YES mentality, NIBC is an enterprising bank that enables ambitions.
What’s in it for you?
NIBC is an ambitious environment where together we strive to create a fantastic workplace where you feel safe and challenged to be the best version of yourself. This is in line Professional, Adaptive, Collaborative and Entrepreneurial, since you are in the lead of setting the PACE of your career at NIBC. In addition, you receive a competitive salary, plus:* Several ways to support your development personally and professionally, a.o.:
* Personal development budget, to spend at your own discretion
* Professional budget provided by your manager, to develop yourself in your work
* In-house training offering
* NIBC embraces the Hybrid way of Working. This means that we support working from home as well as encourage our colleagues to come to the office. NIBC's guideline is to spend at least half of the working time at the office;
* Travel expenses or NS Business Card 1st class;
* 32 holidays (which do not have to be registered);
* Excellent pension scheme (26% NIBC contribution);
* A voucher to improve your home office;
* The opportunity to take ownership and show initiative in your role. We are always open to new ideas, and encourage to use your voice;
* The nature of our Grow to Make a Difference program enables you to be in charge of your own development;
* Two staff associations: YoungNIBC and MyLeisure;
* Vitality program, annual company-wide sports & leisure days;
* Monthly internet allowance;
* Laptop and a company phone;
* Excellent facilities at the office (Coffeecorner, Restaurant, Exchange bar); · Last but not least, a fun workplace in which diversity and inclusion is valued (click here).


What do you bring?
Qualifications:* Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Data Science, Computer Science, or a related field.
* 2-5 years of experience in MLOps, preferably within the risk domain or banking sector.
* Proficiency in Python for developing, deploying, and managing machine learning models.
* Strong understanding of data science modeling concepts and techniques.
* Experience working with Databricks and AzureML.
* Familiarity with GUI development using tools like Streamlit.
* Excellent communication and collaboration skills.
* Attention to detail and a meticulous approach to process management.
* Experience in working in Agile/Scrum/DevOps teams or clear understanding of the methodology.
* Fluent English.


Advantageous to have:* Azure certification(s).
* Experience in risk management or financial services.
* Experience with MATLAB applications and operationalizing them.


Still intrigued?
Click the apply button now! To upload multiple documents, click the upload button again after uploading a document. An assessment may be part of the application procedure. For more information about the recruitment procedure or NIBC as employer you may contact our HR Servicedesk via AskHR@nibc.com

title: Junior Maintenance Engineer Consultant
description:
Wil jij een kijkje in diverse project ‘keukens’ en werken binnen asset- en maintenance management voor verschillende opdrachtgevers in de productie-industrie of infra? Ben je een ondernemend persoon, continu opzoek naar kansen en wil je je techniekkennis verdiepen? Lees dan snel door!

Stel je voor: een belangrijke brug op een drukke snelweg geeft een storing. Tijdens de ochtendspits. Als maintenance engineer gaan jouw radertjes draaien. Hoe had dit voorkomen kunnen worden? Welke signalen zijn gemist? Jij hebt in jouw werk namelijk inzichtelijk hoe de bedrijfsmiddelen, oftewel de assets, van jouw opdrachtgever ervoor staan. Je houdt je dagelijks bezig met asset- en reliability management. Op basis van analyses maak je een goede afweging tussen prestaties, risico’s en kosten en doe je verbetervoorstellen.

**Wat ga je doen als Junior Maintenance Engineer?**

Als Junior Maintenance Engineer heb je bovenal één belangrijke missie: leren, ervaren en beter worden! Net als onze andere collega’s ga je vier van de vijf werkdagen als consultant aan de slag bij onze opdrachtgevers in de productie-industrie of infrasector. Je bent verantwoordelijk voor het optimaliseren van onderhoudstrategieën voor de bedrijfsmiddelen (assets). Je stelt onderhoudsconcepten op en vertaalt deze naar onderhoudsplannen en begrotingen. Uit analyses van onderhoud -en storingsinformatie adviseer jij verbetervoorstellen.

Als junior weet je natuurlijk nog niet alles, maar maak je juist gebruik van de skill-set die je wel al hebt. Wij helpen je met de vakinhoudelijke kennis die je nodig hebt om de taken goed uit te voeren. Je wordt begeleid door een ervaren collega waarmee je wekelijks spart over je ervaringen en uitdagingen die je tegenkomt. Daarmee heb je ook een sponsor die je helpt je eigen ambitie zo snel mogelijk te verwezenlijken.

Naast het werken bij de klant, werk je één dag per week aan de bedrijfsontwikkeling van Veerenstael. Dat kan zijn het ontwikkelen van nieuwe toolings (check bijvoorbeeld de Veerenstael Quickscanof Asset Management Experience), Veerenstael’s beleid afspraken, het helpen bij een project van een collega of aan je eigen ontwikkeling.

**Jouw functie op een rijtje**

* Informatie over de bedrijfsmiddelen verzamelen en analyseren. Denk hierbij aan systeem- en onderhoudsprestaties, storingsanalyses en root-cause-analyses.
* Samenstellen en onderbouwen van de onderhoudswerkzaamheden. Je stelt bijvoorbeeld onderhoudsconcepten en onderhoudsplannen op.
* Kiezen voor een aanpak die tastbare resultaten oplevert en je opdrachtgever daarin meenemen.
* De nachtrust van je opdrachtgever veiligstellen. Jij bent de onderhoudsdeskundige die hen ontzorgt bij een efficiënte inzet van assets.

**Over Veerenstael**  
Veerenstael is een kennisbedrijf en gespecialiseerd in het vakgebied maintenance- en asset management. We helpen bedrijven in de productie-industrie en infra hun onderhoudsprestaties te verbeteren. Machineprestaties stellen we objectief vast, we optimaliseren onderhoudsprocessen en we laten onderhoudsmanagementapplicaties hierop aansluiten. Bovendien zorgen we ervoor dat onderhoudsprestaties aantoonbaar en herleidbaar zijn. Wij zijn perfect voor de projecten waarbij een klant tijdelijk expertise nodig heeft vanuit onderhoudsmanagement, procesbeheersing en applicatiekennis. Wij staan graag met onze voeten in de klei, waarbij onze mensen de rol pakken van vakinhoudelijk expert tot kennis partner voor de klant.Veerenstael stimuleert ook jouw persoonlijke ontwikkeling. Als kennisbedrijf zijn de mensen ten slotte onze belangrijkste middelen om de klant te kunnen helpen. Sowieso maak je, samen met je leidinggevende, een persoonlijk ontwikkelingsplan waarin jouw ambities worden gekoppeld aan mogelijke projecten, leerervaringen en opleidingen. Daarnaast wordt je lid van één van onze Gildes; dit zijn vakgroepen waarin ontwikkelingen in een specialisme worden gevolgd, besproken en vertaald naar ontwikkelingsmogelijkheden voor Veerenstael. Voorbeelden van Gildes zijn; Maintenance management, Procesbeheersing, Data analytics en Change management.Naast ontwikkeling is sfeer natuurlijk net zo belangrijk. Sowieso ben je altijd welkom op ons kantoor in Woerden waar er dagelijks een lunch voor je klaar staat (nooit meer boterhammen smeren!) Verder is er maandelijks altijd iets te doen; van mountainbiken tot pizza avond tot wintersport met het hele team. Niets is verplicht, maar je bent altijd welkom.Duurzaamheid is een belangrijk onderwerp, wat van ons allemaal investeringen gaat vragen. Veerenstael kijkt met zorg hoe we onze invloed op het klimaat kunnen beperken. Denk mee hoe we dit verder kunnen ontwikkelen!

De uitdagende en uiteenlopende werkzaamheden van onze juniors zijn beschreven in onderstaande blogs:

https://www.veerenstael.nl/nieuws/hoe-is-het-om-te-werken-als-maintenance-management-consultant/

https://www.veerenstael.nl/nieuws/7-gave-interne-activiteiten-waar-ik-aan-heb-gewerkt-bij-veerenstael/

**Wat breng je mee**

* Afgeronde HBO/WO opleiding in de techniek (Zoals Technische bedrijfskunde, Elektrotechniek, Werktuigbouwkunde, Bouwkunde etc.);
* Goede communicatieve vaardigheden;
* Een flexibele en pragmatische instelling;
* Affiniteit met bedrijfskunde en techniek;
* Pré’s: Ervaring in consultancy, project management of toegepaste techniek.

En als je dit nou niet op zak hebt, maar wel interesse hebt in techniek, bedrijfskunde of projectbeheersing? Doe eens gek en neem dan toch contact met ons op. We investeren met plezier tijd en een kop goede koffie in jouw carrière. We bespreken graag met je of we ergens anders aanknopingspunten zien.
