We hebben meerdere opdrachtgevers waar jouw technische opleiding, ervaring en ambities misschien wel beter passen dan in de functie van maintenance engineer.

**Wat bieden wij jou?**

* Salaris tussen € 2.800,- en € 3.700,- bruto per maand;
* Ruim opleidingsbudget;
* Interessante opdrachten bij toonaangevende klanten in zowel de productie industrie als de infra sector;
* Bonus regeling. Hoe meer uren je maakt, hoe meer je mee naar huis neemt!;
* Leaseauto, reiskostenvergoeding of NS Business Card;
* Werkplek op de project locatie of bij de opdrachtgever en op het kantoor van Veerenstael in Woerden;
* 28 vakantiedagen;
* Pensioenregeling;
* Werken bij een dynamisch bedrijf met grote ambities.

**Contact**  
We kijken ernaar uit van je te horen! Ben jij ook enthousiast geworden over deze vacature voor Junior Maintenance Engineer , dan ontvangen we graag jouw cv via het formulierhieronder. Voor vragen mag je natuurlijk altijd contact opnemen. Dit kan met Tobias Struijk, via **tobias.struijk@veerenstael.nl** of 06-23316901.

--------

Soort dienstverband: Fulltime, Parttime, Vaste baan, Betaalde opleiding / bbl

Salaris: €2.800,00 - €3.700,00 per maand

Verwacht aantal uur: 32 – 40 per week

Arbeidsvoorwaarden:

* Auto van de zaak
* Bedrijfsfeesten
* Budget voor professionele ontwikkeling
* Dienstreizen vergoeding
* Extra vakantiedagen
* Flexibele werkuren
* Kerstpakket
* Mogelijkheid tot promotie
* Pensioen
* Reiskostenvergoeding
* Telefoonplan
* Vrijdagmiddagborrel
* Werk vanuit huis
* Winstdeling

Werkschema:

* Flexibele werkuren
* ma-vr

Werklocatie: Hybride werken in 3447 GG Woerden

title: Data Analyst - Transaction Banking
description:
Data Analyst - Transaction Banking**In het kort**
---------------


Ben jij een Data Analist met een passie voor de financiële sector en ben je enthousiast om meer te leren over verschillende bancaire producten? Wil jij deel uitmaken van een jong en zeer gemotiveerd team vol met Data Professionals die het vertrouwen krijgen om data in te zetten voor strategische, operationele, en tactische besluitvorming? Klinkt het idee van een autonoom team met veel vrijheid om te leren, te groeien en impact te maken interessant? Bij het BI & Analytics Center of Expertise ben je aan het juiste adres!

**Je werk**
-----------


In jouw rol als Data Analist ga je:

* Fungeren als een data-sparringpartner voor onze stakeholders voor KPIs en rapportages, met relevante inzichten voor het juiste publiek.
* Onderliggende processen van verschillende producten en diensten begrijpen en zal je goed de verbanden kunnen leggen
* Zowel zelfstanding als gezamenlijk met je mede-analisten aan interessante cases werken
* Deelnemen aan complexe lange termijnprojecten, met focus op continious delivery en een MVP way-of-working
* Bruikbare inzichten uit grote databronnen halen en voer je periodieke/ad hoc kwantitatieve analyses en rapportages uit
* Data-onderzoek/-analyse uitvoeren op verschillende datasets (producten, transacties, kanalen, klanten)
* Samenwerken met multidisciplinaire teams en promoot je teams die samenwerken op verschillende niveaus
* De kunst van storytelling optimaliseren door middel van cijfers en effectieve visualisatietechnieken
* Analytisch en georganiseerd te werk en heb je zowel een oog voor detail als voor het grotere geheel
* Gefocust op continue verbetering en het automatiseren van huidige processen
* Nieuwsgierig te werk, stel je voldoende vragen om dieper in de stof te duiken en aarzel je niet om de status quo uit te dagen
* Proactief te werk met het zoeken naar verbetermogelijkheden met betrekking tot team, processen en data
**Werkomgeving**
----------------


De Products Data Practice afdeling is onderdeel van de Data Domains: Accounts, Savings & Transactions, and Insurances (AST&I). Momenteel worden deze Data Domains opgezet binnen de bank-wijde implementatie van het Federated Data Governance Model. De AST&I Data Domains vallen binnen de Transaction Banking productunit, die een uitgebreid portfolio van producten omvat: betaal- en spaarrekeningen, betaalkaarten, productpakketten, verzekeringen, open banking API's, trade finance, digitale producten zoals Apple Pay/Google Pay, en bijbehorende sales-, business- & risicomanagementprocessen. Wij dragen voor een significant deel bij aan de inkomsten van de bank, beheren verschillende regelgevende en operationele onderwerpen, en dragen bij aan de Objectives & Key Results die zijn vastgesteld voor de Personal & Business Banking Client Unit, waarmee we ongeveer 6 miljoen Personal & Business Banking klanten bedienen.


De Products Data Practice afdeling bestaat uit twee Centers of Expertise: 1) Het BI&Analytics CoE, een team van data-analisten verantwoordelijk voor BI & Reporting en Data Analytics, en 2) Het Advanced Analytics & AI Center of Expertise (AA&AI CoE), een team van Data Scientists verantwoordelijk voor het portfolio van AA&AI use cases in lijn met de strategie van de AST&I Data Domains. Daarnaast is Products Data Practice verantwoordelijk voor ons cloud-based data- en analytics platform, de Transaction Banking Domain Data Store (DDS).


De visie van het team is om een omgeving te stimuleren waarin data essentieel is voor alles wat we doen. Wij passen geavanceerde analyses en opkomende technologieën toe om waardevolle inzichten te verkennen, onderzoeken en verzamelen; we definiëren, rapporteren & monitoren en verbeteren de prestaties voor verschillende productgroepen; adviseren hen over nieuwe voorstelontwerpen en duty of care-onderwerpen; voorspellen en prognosticeren trends in het gebruik van producten; helpen bij het bepalen van de koers en het stellen van prioriteiten om grote klanttevredenheid en leveranciersrelaties te bereiken. We fungeren ook als veranderaars om een data-gedreven mindset op alle niveaus van de organisatie te verankeren, waardoor ze het volledige potentieel van de data die we hebben kunnen benutten en daarmee de ontwikkeling & kennis van data binnen de bank versterken.


Al onze Data Analysts en Scientists hebben een T-profiel en naast Data Analysts & Scientists kunnen ze verschillende rollen vervullen zoals: Lead Analysts, Subject Matter Experts, Business Liaisons, etc. Products Data Practice telt meer dan 25 werknemers (65% Analysts & Scientists + 35% Engineers & Modelers) en bestaat uit 7 nationaliteiten die gevestigd zijn in Nederland en India. We volgen agile werkmethodes en werken aan cross-grid en cross-functionele initiatieven in samenwerking met andere data teams, Business Experts, Business Developers, Product Owners, Seniors en leiders – waardoor er een uitstekende mogelijkheid ontstaat om te netwerken en de omgeving dienst als een kenniscentrum. We hebben een cultuur ontwikkeld waarin ondernemerschap, empathie, plezier en het vieren van successen echt worden nageleefd. Dit doen we door de values van de bank te respecteren en na te leven: Care, Courage en Collaboration!

**Je profiel**
--------------


Denk je dat je geschikt bent? Hieronder staan de gevraagde kwalificaties:

* Diploma in STEM of economie/bedrijfskunde, met een focus op analytics
* 3-5 jaar werkervaring, waarvan minimaal 2 jaar op analytisch gebied
* Vaardigheid in programmeertalen zoals SQL of Python
* Ervaring met datavisualisatie tools zoals PowerBI of Tableau
* Kennis over datawarehouse-concepten en datamodelleringstechnieken
* Basis kennis in Advance Analytics technieken (Forecasting, Prediction, Cluster Analysis & Machine Learning) of de motivatie om dit te ontwikkelen
* Een sterke combinatie van analytische vaardigheden, intellectuele nieuwsgierigheid, communicatieve en rapportagevaardigheden
* Uitstekende schriftelijke en mondelinge communicatieve vaardigheden in het Nederlands en het Engels
* Nice to have: Ervaring met werken op azure/ databricks/ of andere cloud platforms
* Nice to have: Kennis van de agile methodologie en het vermogen om verschillende prioriteiten gelijktijdig te manage
* Nice to have: Kennis van Data Warehouse technieken en data modellering technieken
* Nice to have: Kennis van de financiële sector en/of bankproducten
* Nice to have: Microsoft PL-300 certificatie
**Wij bieden**
--------------

* Wij bieden je de vrijheid om het beste uit jezelf te halen, flexibel te werken in a hybride werkomgeving en veel ruimte om te groeien
* De mogelijkheid om proactief aan je vitaliteit en fitheid te werken
* Een concurrerend salaris, passend bij je ervaring en kennis
* Een aanvullend benefit budget van 11%, waarmee je flexibel arbeidsvoorwaarden kunt kopen
* Een persoonlijk ontwikkelbudget van € 1.000 per jaar
* Een jaarlijkse OV-kaart
* Een goede pensioenregeling en uitstekende secundaire arbeidsvoorwaarden
**Interesse?**
--------------


Wil je meer weten over de functie, solliciteer dan direct en wij zullen contact met je opnemen.

**Gelijke kansen voor iedereen**
--------------------------------

**Disclaimer externe recruitmentbureaus**
-----------------------------------------

### **Wij vragen**

* Een motiverende kracht

### **Wij bieden**

* Analytische skills
company_description: Bij ABN AMRO hebben we een duidelijke purpose: Banking for better, for generations to come. Samen met onze klanten gaan we de uitdagingen van onze tijd aan en geven we vorm aan de toekomst.

title: Senior Data Engineer
description:
### **SENIOR DATA ENGINEER**


Our team in **Amsterdam** currently has an opening for a **Senior Data Engineer**


Brenntag is undergoing a group-wide transformation to deliver profitable organic growth and sustained group efficiencies. Data & Analytics is a key pillar which will allow us to ‘liberate’ our data and thus improve our decision-making at speed.  

  

We are looking for talented, self-starters with a passion for analytics to join our growing team. Our Data Engineering team is the key foundational capability to enable end to end analytics. As part of the Data Engineering team, your role has accountability for building the trusted high quality data products. Those data products will be used in various modern analytics products such as product recommendation engine, demand forecasting engine, pricing engine or management dashboards.  

  

You will collaborate with the Data Scientist, Data Visualization Designer/ Developers and ML Engineers, working within agile squads to ensure delivery of working and scalable analytics products.


### **YOUR ROLE & RESPONSIBILITIES**


* Design, develop and maintain data ingestion, data processing and data producing pipelines according to the best practices
* Design and build reusable components, frameworks, and libraries at scale to support analytics products
* Build continuous integration and continuous deployment scripts to ensure high quality production
* Design and develop data quality observability and/or monitoring scripts, along with automated alerting
* Analyze and profile data for the purpose of developing analytics products
* Collaborate with a cross functional agile team of platform engineers, software engineers, data scientists, and product owners to build new products


### **YOUR PROFILE**


* A Masters degree in computer science, computer engineering, information technology or relevsant experience with other degree8+ years data engineering experience
* Strong skills in one or more programming languages related to data engineering (such as Python and Scala)
* Hands on experience with cloud environments such as (AWS alternatively Google Cloud/Azure)
* Hands on experience with Big Data and NoSQL technologies like Spark, Impala, HBase, Cassandra, Storm, Flume, Pig, or Hive
* Experience with event-driven data designs (Kafka)
* Experience with monitoring and alerting (Grafana, Logstash, Cloudwatch)
* Hands on experience in continuous integration and continuous delivery (CI/CD) tooling
* Experience with IaaC such as CDK, Terraform or similar concepts (Bicep, Ansible)
* Experience working on end-to-end solution designHas a strong problem solving and analytical mindset

### **OUR OFFER**


* Unique greenfield environment to drive change in a global business
* Open space in a vibrant start-up corporate incubator
* Lots of possibilities for professional development
* International team
* Friendly and supportive colleagues
* Competitive compensation package


### **INTERESTED?**


We look forward receiving your application.

  

  

  

Brenntag provides equal employment opportunities to qualified applicants and employees of all backgrounds and identities to create a workplace where difference is valued because it forms a resilient and more innovative organization. We do not discriminate on the basis of age, disability, gender identity, sexual orientation, ethnicity, race, religion or belief, parental and family status, or any other protected characteristic. We welcome applications from women, men and non-binary candidates of all ethnicities and socio-economic backgrounds.
company_description: Brenntag distributes chemicals and ingredients worldwide, offering tailored solutions in supply chain, marketing, and technical support across industries.

title: Business Intelligence Engineer Intern
description:
### **What we expect from this role**



As our Business Intelligence Intern, you will play an important role in our organisation by building automated data pipelines, creating dashboards and gathering actionable insights to support our business strategies.



We are looking for somebody who loves getting "into the data", improving data-driven decision-making processes, translating business questions into BI solutions, applying analytics rigour to strategic questions and collaborating effectively with colleagues. If you like to jump on a high-speed train, enjoy all the learnings that come from a rapidly changing environment, get energy from having autonomy and enjoy an environment where decisions are made in a minute, this role might be for you!


### **What you will be doing**


* **Analytical problem solving and Business analysis**: Break down business problem and use data-driven methods to get valuable insights (e.g. customer retention, cost- usage analysis.
* **ETL Development & data integration**: Develop and maintain automated ETL pipelines to consolidate data from various raw data sources and integrate them into a unified database ensuring consistency, accuracy, reliability and quality of the data.
* **Data visualisation**: Create and improve Tableau dashboards, focusing on usability, and performances to empower internal users with actionable insights and data- driven decision making (e.g Product KPIs, Portfolio activity).
* **Report and Documentation**: Support with internal reports (e.g. monthly usage report, investors report) and contribute to the maintenance of documentation (ETL processes, data integration workflows, and database schemas)

### **What you will bring**


* Currently enrolled or recently completed a degree in Business Analytics, Data Science, Computer Science, or a related field Proficiency in SQL, Python, database architecture and management
* Proactivity and self-motivation with a desire to learn and grow in the field of business intelligence or business engineering
* Ability to extract and organise BI requirements from internal stakeholders
* Ability to build relationships with excellent interpersonal skills
* Knowledge or interest in visualisation tool (Tableau)
* Fluent in written and spoken business English

### **What you get**


* A fun, young and innovative atmosphere
* An entrepreneurial environment where you learn more every day
* Personal responsibility with a ton of autonomy and growth potential
* A chance to see your work make a real difference in the real world and change a traditional business impacting every day of our lives
* A fantastic location in the city centre of Amsterdam
* Great hangouts with brilliant people
* Some additional cool perks – see below!

title: Network Security Specialist
description:
ABOUT US
We’re building Tomorrow’s Connections Today, bringing people together through the power of our technology.
Liberty Global is a world leader in converged broadband, video and mobile communications and an active investor in cutting-edge infrastructure, content and technology ventures.
With our investments in fibre-based and 5G networks we play a vital role in society, currently providing over 85 million fixed and mobile connections and rolling out the next generation of products and services, while readying our networks for 10 Gbps and beyond.
We’re creating national champions, combining the best broadband and mobile networks under brands such as Virgin Media-02 in the UK, VodafoneZiggo in The Netherlands, Telenet in Belgium, Sunrise in Switzerland, Virgin Media in Ireland and UPC in Slovakia.
Liberty Global Ventures, our global investment arm, has a portfolio of more than 75 companies and funds across content, technology and infrastructure, including strategic stakes in ITV, Univision, Plume, Lionsgate and the Formula E racing series.
Our scale enables us to transfer knowledge and expertise across our operations and investments, creating a dynamic family of brands united in the pursuit of innovation and excellence.
And we’re prioritising diversity, equity and inclusion in our workplace and communities, while reducing our impact on the environment. We are using technology as a force for good; for our people, our partners and the planet.
JOB PURPOSE
You will assure that our core and global tier-1 network has sound and industry best practice security protection and that the security of these products are monitored.
The role will work closely together with Liberty Global core network architects, engineering and operational and global security teams to identify improvements and drive Network Hygiene security improvements and provide specialized skills in case of investigations.
The role includes the ability to translate security findings or deficiencies to security risks and advise the organization on blocking issues and acceptable risk.* Identify and drive improvements on Network Security on the tier-1 core network of Liberty Global.
* Identify and advise our ISP networks to implement similar security measures and monitoring.
* Review and generate technical specifications/documentation
* Translate, create, and hand over network monitoring use cases and tread play books to incident response teams
* Act as a mentor, technical lead and escalation point for other engineers
* Monitor and respond to incidents


KEY ACCOUNTABILITIES* Serve as an authority on Internet security related questions on topics like Network Hygiene, MANRS, DDoS mitigation, BGP routing and traffic analysis.
* Trace and identify sources of BGP hijacks, BGP leaks, DDoS, malware or other abuse traffic
* Review and update/improve security requirements set in policies/guidelines and make sure that these are following industry best practice.
* Identify potential areas of improvement and drive implementation.
* Liaise with the Global Security Operations Centre, LG and external operational teams and other Business units to have the right priorities set for maximum effect.
* Work with and understand deliverables of external bodies like M3AAWG, CableLabs, RIPE, and other security and standards organizations to assure Liberty Global networks and services follow industry Best Practice regarding Security areas.


We tend to look for people with:* Solid grasp of Networking, Security and Monitoring
* Experience and expertise in securing and protecting large (ISP) networks.
* Familiarity with network hygiene measures such as BCP38/84 anti-spoofing protection, RPKI, and other BGP routing BCPs, RIRs, and Internet Routing Registries, DNS/DNSSEC, and domain registration.
* Strong grasp of network security vulnerabilities and protections like: Denial of Service attacks and mitigation, BGP Hijacking, CoPP, access-lists, Tacacs, Spam/malware/abuse.
* Experience in presenting findings and making recommendations to other operational teams.
* Experience in working with many collaborators to improve security and incident response both internal and external in an international community.
* Demonstrated ability in an ISP environment and Internet security arena.
* Experience with Internet organizations like RIR's and domain name registries and tools like whois/RDAP, RIPE RIS, BGP and DNS monitoring. RIPE NCC certification (Database/BGP security) is a plus.
* Solid understanding of network security, security monitoring, and layers of defense principles.


SKILLS & ABILITIES:* Fluency in English (speaking/writing)
* Superb communication skills


Extensive knowledge or interest of at least 4 of the following areas:* Networking, TCP/IP, IPv4/IPv6 and main services used by applications
* BGP, RPKI, Control Plane Policing (CoPP), DNS/DNSSEC
* Protection against DOS attacks, amplification factors and mitigation techniques
* Security analytics capabilities
* Experience with monitoring and analytics solutions (e.g. Arbor threat mitigation suite, Splunk, Grafana, Elastic Stack etc…)
* Basic scripting/programming/database skills.
* A great teammate, able to prioritise effectively and work independently well under pressure.
* Working with internal / external working groups to support improving network security and reduce impact of Denial of Service attack factors or other service disruptive activities in our footprint.


Some of the benefits we offer:* Competitive salary + Bonus
* 25 days annual leave with the option to purchase 5 more
* Free access to LinkedIn Learning & Coursera to continue to develop and grow your career with us
* Company Pension Contributions
* Free premium subscription to Calm – a renowned well-being & meditation app (NL only)
* Free public transport subscription that can be used for both work and leisure travel on all modes of public transport, anywhere in the Netherlands
* Subsidy on health insurance premium
* Company Laptop, Mobile and Phone Subscription


Liberty Global is an equal opportunity employer. We embrace diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for our people. We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process. We’re 100% committed to having a workforce that represents every part of our society. So we’re keen to hear from candidates of all background and circumstances.
company_description: We’re building Tomorrow’s Connections Today, bringing people together through the power of our technology.

title: Data Analytics Engineer
description:
Netherlands Data Science Eindhoven On-site
If you have a passion for data, an analytical mindset, and a keen interest in the manufacturing industry, we want to hear from you..

  


About The Member Company
We are a global high-tech consultancy company with a team of entrepreneurial engineers, scientists, and digital experts from around the world. Together we form a fast-growing and proud community. We offer consultancy services to high-profile clients globally in diverse service areas, such as:


* Technology & Engineering
* Energy & Renewables
* Life sciences & Pharma
* Digital & IT
**About this vacancy**
----------------------


* Build and Own Infrastructure: Develop and maintain robust, reliable data pipelines to centralize analytics data.
* Workstream Ownership: Collaborate with cross-functional teams and stakeholders to define and deliver analytics solutions.
* Data-Driven Decision Making: Proactively contribute to and support data-driven decision-making processes.
* Semantic Layer Creation: Design user-friendly semantic layers for ad hoc analysis, routine reporting, and/or data science modeling to enable easy data analysis for end users. Ensure friendly naming conventions, well-defined metrics, and optimized performance.
* Data Quality Assurance: Implement best-in-class alerting and data quality checks to proactively identify data integrity errors.
* Software Engineering Practices: Apply best practices to analytics code, including version control and testing.
* Documentation: Document new datasets and pipelines, explaining their structure and purpose.
* Team Culture Contribution: Collaborate, share knowledge, and upskill teammates to contribute to a positive team culture.


**What we expect from you**
---------------------------


* Experience: 4+ years as an Analyst/Data Engineer.
* Technical Skills: 3+ years with AWS, Python, and ETL development; 2+ years with Big Data Technologies such as Databricks and Spark; 1+ year with data engineering technologies such as Airflow, Redshift, Spark, and Kubernetes.
* Data Analysis: Advanced expertise in Data Analysis, Tableau, and SQL.
* Communication: Exceptional written and oral communication skills with the ability to influence multiple levels of the organization.
* Industry Experience: Previous experience in the manufacturing industry and their IT systems.
* Statistics: Proficient in statistics and exploratory data analysis.
* Adaptability: Willingness to roll up your sleeves to get the job done and to commit to a fast-paced startup working culture.
* Audience Adaptability: Ability to tailor communication for a wide variety of audiences, both technical and non-technical.


Preferred Qualifications and Skills:* dbt Experience: Hands-on experience with dbt.
* Forecasting and Predictive Analytics: Experience with time series forecasting, predictive analytics, and machine learning.
* NLP and AI Frameworks: Familiarity with frameworks such as NLTK, Spacy, TensorFlow, or PyTorch.
* DevOps and DataOps: Functional knowledge in these areas.
* Problem-Solving: Ability to work through uninformative assumptions and biases in datasets without being stalled by imperfect or sparse data.


**What you can expect from us**
-------------------------------


TMC is an international high-tech consultancy company that brings expertise to their clients in order to support them with the realization of their technological challenges. As such, TMC is operating as an expert center at the disposition of its clients and we help them to be more competitive in an ever more global and faster changing technological world.At TMC we believe that people are the driving force behind technological innovation. That is why we want to create the best possible conditions for tech talents to thrive in. We offer you a challenging and stimulating work environment in which you can be the director of your own career.As an Employeneur you are part of our TMC family. Next to our outstanding technical expertise, fun and engagement are meaningful parts of our culture.


The 5 basic principles of **employeneurship**
A long-term working relationship
Enjoy the security of a long-term contract and a stable source of income while getting the opportunity to work at diverse projects.


Individual profit sharing
Full transparency. That’s it. For each of your projects, you know your hourly rate, your costs, and your individual performance-based profit sharing, all in order to stimulate your inner entrepreneur.


Business cells
Our employeneurs are grouped in business cells based on their technical expertise. They are small, focused and function as high-grade knowledge networks. And as buzzing communities of close colleagues.


YOUniversity
Every employeneur drives their own career. Together, we make a plan for personal and professional growth. Receive personal coaching and an extensive training budget to keep developing yourself and deliver outperformance at our clients.

  

The Entrepreneurial Lab
Work on your technical dreams in our lab. Collaborate with others in multidisciplinary teams to unlock out-of-the-box thinking and innovative ideas as well as entrepreneurial skills.
company_description: At TMC we believe it's people who drive technology. Our Employeneurship model creates the best conditions for technical talents to do so.

title: Data Platform Engineer (100%)
description:
MSF is an international, independent medical humanitarian organization. We are a non-profit, self-governed worldwide movement of more than 63,000 people.



We provide emergency medical assistance during armed conflict, natural disasters, outbreaks of deadly diseases and assist those who are excluded from healthcare. MSF delivers care based on need and when we see injustice, we speak out. We are an organization that remains impartial, knowledgeable, and effective, and this is what makes the difference between life and death.



People are our priority. At Médecins Sans Frontières (MSF)/Artsen zonder Grenzen, we are committed to an inclusive culture that encourages and supports the diverse voices of our employees. We encourage diverse applicants including individuals of all gender identities, ages, sexual orientations, nationalities, races, religions, beliefs, social and marital status, people with different abilities and all other diversity characteristics and how they work together.

  




With immediate effect, MSF OCA is currently looking for a:

  


**Data** **Platform** **Engineer** **(100%)**



Based in Amsterdam

  




**Day in the life of a Data** **Platform** **Engineer at MSF**

  




You start your day with the bi-weekly operational update from the OPS department to hear what is going on in our projects, for instance in our Cholera project in Goma or vaccination campaign in South Sudan. Then it’s time to get to your engineering work. You consult with your stakeholders during a short daily stand-up on how to extract the data from one of our HR systems and properly transform it in our Azure SQL DB, ready to be used for analytics.



As you will be at least coding 50% of the time that day, you have plenty of time focusing on the development of this data pipeline in Azure Data Factory and by a Python script calling an API. Related to this is the setup & maintenance of our MSF Azure Central Data Hub infrastructure, fixing bugs, improving code base (optimizing performance for instance). Data evangelism and scrum ceremonies (the stand-ups, retros and alignment with the different stakeholders) will also demand some time that day, but you manage to spark enthusiasm of your achievements so far.



In the late afternoon you have a brainstorming about the plentiful opportunities to automate monitoring and data quality checks for other projects, and to identify a possible implementation of a ML model into production that a data scientist has created. We work on the latest cutting-edge Azure tech-stack.



At the end of the day, as it happens to be Friday, you join the data team for a well-earned drink!

  




**Objectives** **and characteristics** **of the role**

  




As a Data Platform Engineer at MSF, you will be responsible for the Azure-based Central Data Hub (CDH). You’ll be designing and implementing new features for the platform itself, as well as delivering well-architected data pipelines that provide numerous stakeholders with their data. You will further strengthen our CDH, by designing and implementing security measures and managing the CI/CD around the platform, with the aim of rolling out changes as quickly and easily as possible in an automated manner.



You will be part of our journey towards more (advanced) analytics and empowering the MSF-wide movement to do their own reporting and analytics through a Self-Service BI approach.



You are part of the Reporting & Analytics team (6 colleagues) and will work closely together with data management specialists, IT architects, data security and privacy officers and our various stakeholders all across MSF.

  




**Main Responsibilities**

  




* Analyse plans and develop high-level solutions for business applications, workflows and information integration in close collaboration with the different departments of MSF Operational Center Amsterdam (OCA).
* Implement and maintain robust data pipelines that manage and secure the flow of structured and unstructured data from multiple sources towards end-users. This can be data extracted from multiple databases that need to be stored in our central SQL database, or data from a wide array of external sources that can be ingested through API’s.
* You strive for an optimal architecture by taking Microsoft’s Well-Architected Review framework into account (Security, Cost Optimization, Operational Excellence, Performance Efficiency and Reliability) and by working closely together with IT and the Data Security Officer;
* You design and implement new features for the Central Data Hub and are responsible for it to function well and secure
* As we move more towards advanced analytics you help deploying models into production and maintain a continuous integration pipeline, including monitoring and optimizing system performance and cost;
* Since Azure is a rapidly changing world, you will learn and stay up-to-date in the latest tools and services in the Azure ecosystem;
* Follow up with super users to guarantee ongoing support. All done closely together with MSF OCA and International Teams;

  


**Candidate Profile**



Technical skills

  




* You hold a Bachelor's or Master's degree (preferably in Computer Science or similar);
* You have at least 4 years of working experience as a Data (Platform) Engineer, preferably with technologies like Microsoft Azure Data Lake Storage, Azure Data Factory, Azure Databricks, Cosmos DB and Azure SQL Server and/or Synapse Analytics;
* You have experience in at least one of the following areas: setting up cloud-based data pipelines, deploying machine learning models or managing a data infrastructure in the Cloud;
* You have knowledge from Infrastructure as code concepts such ARM, BICEP or Terraform.
* You are familiar with DevOps principles and CI/CD
* You can program in Python

  


Soft skills

  




* You have experience working in Agile/ Scrum teams;
* You are experienced in explaining technical topics to non-technical professionals
* You are service-oriented and demonstrate initiative with a good follow-up attitude;
* Excellent communication skills in English.

  


Nice to have

  




* You have working experience in an international environment, with daily collaboration with and within multicultural groups;
* You are certified in DP-203 (Azure Data Engineer).
* Familiarity with server and serverless solutions, such as containerization, logic apps, batch accounts

  


**We offer**

  




A Dutch employment contract, based on 40 hours per week. It is a one-year contract with a renewal option.



A gross monthly salary in scale 17 with a current salary range between 4,665 and 6,422 euro depending on relevant work experience, based on a fulltime appointment.

  




**Other benefits include:**

  




30 days off (based on a full-time employment)



A premium free pension where MSF covers 100% of the monthly pension contribution



8% holiday allowance, paid out with the salary in May



Commuting allowance (terms and conditions apply) & work from home allowance



Hybrid working is possible (upon prior arrangement)



L&D will support you with a variety of learning and development opportunities with internal and external trainings and courses



An environment that fosters diversity, with colleagues from around the world representing various cultures and background



Discounted daily lunch at the office

  


**Information & application**

  




If you recognise yourself in this profile, we welcome you to apply directly via our website and upload a letter of motivation + Curriculum Vitae (in English) as one combined document.



The closing date for applications is **1****5****th** **of A****ugust** **2024 at 23:59h.**



Please note the application deadline specified above may be subject to extension at MSF-Netherland’s discretion.



The process will consist of two interview rounds.



Please note that only candidates that fully meet the requirements of the position will be taken into consideration.

  




For more information about the recruitment process, please contact Masha Petrovic (Recruiter) at masa.petrovic@amsterdam.msf.org

  




For more infromation about the role and the team, please contact the hiring manager Stephane Chambet-Weil stephane.chambet-weil@amsterdam.msf.org

  


At Médecins Sans Frontières (MSF) / Artsen zonder Grenzen, we are committed to an inclusive culture that encourages and supports the diverse voices of our employees. We encourage applications from individuals of all genders, ages, sexual orientations, nationalities, races, religions, beliefs, disability status, and all other diversity characteristics.

  


 \*\*\*No agencies please\*\*\*

title: Genesys Cloud CX engineer / consultant
description:
**This is what you will do**
----------------------------


Odido’s ambition is to become the undisputed Customer Champion in the Netherlands which puts the customer at the heart of its business. To support this ambition there is extensive focus on improving the customer journey as well as the employee experience.


**For this role we are looking for candidates that are already living in The Netherlands. No need to apply when living abroad.**


To facilitate the ambitions Odido is currently migrating from Genesys PureConnect towards Genesys Cloud (CX3) to make sure that future innovations and improvements can be realized. The product vision & strategy of the platform consist of:


* Simplify & optimize the setup of our IVR flows to support all our brands and to realize a high percentage of automated customer recognition
* Enhance the routing capabilities based on available customer information (like frequent callers, open orders)
* Enable & train our business departments within Customer Service & Sales to easily change certain business parameters & configurations to reduce time to market
* Investigate & unlock valuable new capabilities being offered in the platform like real-time speech analytics, sentiment analysis and Salesforce Service Cloud integration.

As a Genesys Engineer/Consultant you are passionate about improving our Voice capabilities & omnichannel platform to support the day-to-day activities our Customer Experience & Sales Officers. These ambassadors have the challenge of handling over 100,000 customer questions & requests on a weekly basis which are initiated via different channels like Voice (75%) but also other channels like E-mail, Chat & Social.


As a Genesys Engineer / Consultant you are primary responsible for:


* Creating solution designs to facilitate new Genesys initiatives
* Implement & improving IVR flows within Genesys CX Platform
* Provide advice from technical perspective how to facilitate & setup the transformation roadmap (to phase out other legacy systems)
* Perform configuration activities within the platform together with other team members
* Align with other internal development teams to align dependencies like API integrations (TIBCO) and our CRM system (Salesforce)
* Staying abreast of all capabilities within the Genesys CX platform & upcoming product releases

**About the team**


You will be part of the Genesys Routing team. The core focus of this team lies on improving & levering all capabilities offered by the Genesys Platform ranging from Voice capabilities, Campaign Management, Quality Management and other (legacy) systems like Aspect CXP (IVR) & Nuance (Speech Recognition).


The product team consists of multiple roles ranging from a Product Development Lead, System Analyst, subject matter experts and several Application Managers. On daily basis the team works & collaborates closely with multiple stakeholders from the Customer Service & Sales department.


**Together we are**
-------------------


We are Odido, the new provider of mobile, fiber optic and TV. And with almost 2,000 colleagues, we show that telecom can be improved. Because technology is for everyone. Wherever you come from, wherever you go. With Odido everyone participates in the digital world. That is our ambition. Everyone at Odido helps to build a brand that is human, optimistic and progressive.


Is that really something for you? Then we might fit well together.


**This is what we stand for**
-----------------------------


Our name - you can also read it from back to front - consists of different shapes. Which together are one. Because that's how we look at the world around us. As a place where people, no matter how different, move forward together. We're there for each other. We always look at opportunities. We celebrate diversity and are committed to an inclusive work environment with equal opportunities for all. That sounds good of course. But we don't stop at fine words: at Odido we are a recognized Top Employer. A confirmation that we are proud of.


**What we offer**
-----------------

* Good salary and variable bonus scheme;
* Hybrid working;
* A progressive pension scheme;
* 30 vacation days (if you work for us full-time) and an extra day off after Ascension Day;
* Redeemable holidays;
* An Odido subscription;
* Real growth opportunities;
* Personal annual learning budget and over 200 digital training and courses;
* Workshops, learning weeks, annual ski trip, fun outings and parties.


**You bring this**
------------------


Required qualifications & experience:


* Has proven track record within Customer Call Center environments
* Has experience with Genesys Cloud CX from a technical and solution direction perspective
* Delivery-focused, analytical, and hands-on with a with a strong ability to adapt to change;
* Is decisive, enthusiastic, friendly, and has a "self-driven mindset"
* Has excellent communication skills;
* Masters Dutch and English language in word and writing;
* Genesys Cloud certifications are a pre.

**Learn every day**
-------------------


At Odido we learn every day. All of us. You are responsible for your own development. That is why you decide how, what and when you learn. We have more than 200 digital training courses with which you can work on professional and personal goals. We don't do old-fashioned performance reviews and assessments. You keep your manager and colleagues informed of your goals and progress. You are in control.


**Press on the button**
-----------------------


Are you as excited about Odido as we are? Then we are probably a good match. We are looking forward to meet you! You can apply via the application button. Done in a minute!
company_description: Wij zijn Odido. Menselijk, Optimistisch en Vooruitstrevend

title: DevOps engineer
description:
**DevOps engineer**
===================


Ben jij als DevOps engineer klaar om een sleutelrol te spelen in de ontwikkeling en het beheer van de Azure infrastructuur voor ons innovatieve digitale zorgplatform? Welkom in ons team!


Reageer t/m 14-08-2024
30.18.24.SB4
  
### **Functie inhoud**


Als DevOps engineer draag jij de verantwoordelijkheid voor het ontwerp, de ontwikkeling en het beheer van onze Azure-infrastructuur voor ons digitaal platform gericht op zorginnovaties. Een cloud-native API- en dataplatform, met een native mobiele app, vormt de kern. Met dit platform gaan we de patiëntbeleving drastisch verbeteren en processen automatiseren. Met diverse functionaliteiten zoals telemonitoring, e-health, chat- en videocontact, algoritmes, chatbots en analytics zijn we bezig de zorg van de toekomst vorm te geven. Jouw rol omvat het doorontwikkelen en beheren van onze bestaande Azure-infrastructuur. Wat ga je doen?


* Ontwerpen van onze Azure infrastructuur en nadenken over de meest efficiënte inzet van services.
* Ontwikkelen van Infrastructure as Code (Bicep) om onze omgeving in te richten en te beheren.
* Opzetten van geautomatiseerde CI/CD-pipelines en monitoring om snel nieuwe features te kunnen leveren en onze omgeving optimaal te laten presteren.
* Werken in een Agile team en ondersteunen van het ontwikkelteam met jouw expertise.
* Optimaliseren van de patiëntbeleving en bijdragen aan innovatieve oplossingen door te brainstormen met collega’s.

  
### **Werkomgeving**


Je komt te werken in het programma “Digitaal Verbonden”. De programmaorganisatie is begin 2022 opgericht en richt zich volledig op het realiseren en implementeren van ons nieuwe digitale platform voor zorginnovaties. Binnen het ontwikkelteam werk jij samen met andere cloud engineers, data engineers, mobile en backend developers en product owners.


  
### **Profiel**


Je hebt al enkele jaren relevante werkervaring als DevOps engineer, bij voorkeur met Microsoft Azure of andere cloudoplossingen. Security is jouw tweede natuur en je geniet van de uitdaging om een omgeving optimaal te “hardenen”. Verder heb je:


* Wo werk- en denkniveau en minimaal een afgeronde hbo-opleiding in informatietechnologie.
* Ervaring met scripting. Bijvoorbeeld PowerShell, Python of Bash.
* Ervaring met Bicep en/of ARM-templates.

  

 

Bekijk hier de voorwaarden voor indiensttreding bij Erasmus MC.


  
### **Wat bieden wij**

  

* Een tijdelijk contract voor 12 maanden.
* Een bruto maandsalaris tussen de € 3.493,- en € 5.504,- (schaal 10) bij een volledige werkweek van 36 uur.
* Deels thuiswerken en 4x9 uur werken is mogelijk.
* Een 13e maand die we al in november uitkeren en een persoonlijk reiskostenbudget.
* Een pensioenverzekering bij het ABP. Wij betalen 70% van je pensioenpremie waardoor je netto salaris hoger uitvalt dan je misschien denkt.
* Sportfaciliteiten, een fietsenmaker en gratis fysiotherapie.

  

 

Alle arbeidsvoorwaarden zijn conform de cao Universitair Medische Centra.


  
### **Meer informatie**


Maak van deze vacature jouw nieuwe baan. Solliciteren is zo gedaan via de sollicitatiebutton.  

  

Inhoudelijke vragen over de vacature? Jos Kuijpers, Azure cloud engineer, beantwoordt deze met plezier via 06 501 622 62 of stuur een WhatsApp.

  

Acquisitie naar aanleiding van deze advertentie is niet gewenst.
company_description: Meewerken aan de zorg van de toekomst. Het begint met doen.

title: Azure Engineer
description:
**The Work**

  

As an Azure Engineer in Accenture Technology - Cloud First, you will play a pivotal role in driving our customers' cloud initiatives, leveraging Microsoft's Azure platform to design, build, migrate, and optimize scalable cloud solutions. Your expertise will be crucial in advancing our customers' cloud adoption strategies, ensuring security, and optimizing their infrastructure through effective use of Azure's vast toolset and frameworks. Join our team and contribute to shaping the future of our customers' cloud infrastructure, leveraging your expertise in Azure to drive innovation and excellence.

* **People** You will collaborate with cross-functional teams, including developers, system administrators, and project managers, to ensure seamless integration and operation of cloud services for our customers. Your ability to communicate effectively and mentor junior team members will be essential in fostering a collaborative and efficient working environment.
* **Process** You will lead the implementation of the Cloud Adoption Framework for our customers, ensuring their processes align with best practices for cloud governance, security, and compliance. Your role will involve refining and enhancing our customers' DevOps processes, facilitating continuous integration and continuous deployment (CI/CD) pipelines, and automating infrastructure management using Infrastructure as Code (IaC) tools like Bicep or Terraform.
* **Technology** Your in-depth understanding of cloud architecture and Azure's capabilities will be instrumental in designing, building, migrating, and optimizing workloads for robust landing zones and other cloud infrastructure components for our customers. You will utilize Azure DevOps tools and services to streamline project workflows and ensure the reliability and scalability of our customers' cloud environments.
* **Task** Day-to-day tasks will include designing and building Azure projects from the ground up for our customers, managing their cloud resources, and ensuring optimal performance and security. You will also be responsible for migrating and optimizing workloads to Azure, troubleshooting and resolving issues related to cloud infrastructure, continuously improving our customers' cloud operations, and staying updated with the latest Azure developments and best practices.


With all our roles, there is some in-person time for collaboration, learning and building relationships with clients, peers, leaders, and communities. As an employer, we will be as flexible as possible to support your specific work/life needs.

 **Who we are**  

  

Through unmatched industry experience, leading technologies from our ecosystem partners and startups, and the largest delivery network in the world, we provide a powerful range of capabilities that can be tailored to our client’s most complex business needs. With over 100 innovation hubs deployed around the world, we help clients continuously innovate at speed and at scale so they can outpace their peers. You will bring innovation, intelligence, and industry experience together with the newest technologies to help clients innovate at scale and transform their businesses.


Technology is one of five services that make up one Accenture – the others are Strategy & Consulting, Operations, Song and Industry X.


  

**Here’s what you’ll need:**

* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field.
* Minimum of 3 years of experience working with Microsoft Azure.
* Proven experience in designing, building, and migrating Azure projects.
* Strong understanding of cloud architecture and cloud security principles.
* Excellent communication and collaboration skills.
* Experience with Infrastructure as Code (IaC) tools such as Bicep or Terraform.
* Hands-on experience with CI/CD and working in a DevOps environment.

**Bonus points:**

  

* Experience with Kubernetes for container orchestration.
* Proficiency in Python for scripting and automation.
* Knowledge of Generative AI (GenAI) and its applications.
* Understanding of data management and analytics in the cloud.
* Expertise in Azure DevOps (ADO).

  



**What’s in it for you?**

  

Accenture is a global company with a world-class brand and reputation. Our people are Change Makers, and to support them as an employer, we make five promises:

* Work with flexibility, in a culture based on trust
* Embrace a sustainable growth mindset
* Live a human-led culture of Inclusion & Diversity by caring deeply for all our people.
* Lead and transform our clients with technology
* Connect with our global network of 700.000 colleagues.


These promises are reflected through our excellent employee benefits, including:

* Flexible working hours (4x9) & work location, FlexMoment leave of absence program (50% paid leave of absence for 3 months) and FlexDay; a flexible day you can take off to celebrate what matters to you – from EidalFitr to a birthday.
* Paid leave: Parental leave, Partner leave for all non-birthing parents, Bereavement leave, and Gender affirmation leave.
* Paid transport (budget for electric bicycle or car, NS-Business card)
* Pension scheme, Accenture shares, annual bonus, collective health insurance scheme
* Social activities like Friday Drinks, sport events and parties

 **What we believe**

  

Accenture is an equal opportunity employer. Our leaders are committed to building a better, stronger and more equitable company for future generations to create positive, long-lasting change. Inclusion and diversity are fundamental to our culture and core values. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. Our rich diversity makes us more innovative and creative, which helps us better serve our clients and our communities.


Our position as partner to many of the world’s leading businesses, organizations and governments affords us both an extraordinary opportunity and a tremendous responsibility to make a difference. Sustainability is one of our greatest responsibilities, which we embed it into everything we do and for everyone we work with.


Accenture is committed to providing equal employment opportunities for all. Please let us know if you require reasonable accommodation to enable your participation in the recruitment process. We will be happy to assist you.
company_description: Our 721,000 people deliver on the promise of technology and human ingenuity every day, serving clients in more than 120 countries. We embrace the power of change to create value and shared success.

title: Data Platform Engineer
description:
**Job Brief**
-------------



As a Data Platform Engineer at MSF, you will be responsible for the Azure-based Central Data Hub (CDH).



MSF is an international, independent medical humanitarian organization. We are a non-profit, self-governed worldwide movement of more than 63,000 people.



We provide emergency medical assistance during armed conflict, natural disasters, outbreaks of deadly diseases and assist those who are excluded from healthcare. MSF delivers care based on need and when we see injustice, we speak out. We are an organization that remains impartial, knowledgeable, and effective, and this is what makes the difference between life and death.



People are our priority. At Médecins Sans Frontières (MSF)/Artsen zonder Grenzen, we are committed to an inclusive culture that encourages and supports the diverse voices of our employees. We encourage diverse applicants including individuals of all gender identities, ages, sexual orientations, nationalities, races, religions, beliefs, social and marital status, people with different abilities and all other diversity characteristics and how they work together.

  




With immediate effect, MSF OCA is currently looking for a:

  


**Data** **Platform** **Engineer** **(100%)**



Based in Amsterdam

  




**Day in the life of a Data** **Platform** **Engineer at MSF**

  




You start your day with the bi-weekly operational update from the OPS department to hear what is going on in our projects, for instance in our Cholera project in Goma or vaccination campaign in South Sudan. Then it’s time to get to your engineering work. You consult with your stakeholders during a short daily stand-up on how to extract the data from one of our HR systems and properly transform it in our Azure SQL DB, ready to be used for analytics.



As you will be at least coding 50% of the time that day, you have plenty of time focusing on the development of this data pipeline in Azure Data Factory and by a Python script calling an API. Related to this is the setup & maintenance of our MSF Azure Central Data Hub infrastructure, fixing bugs, improving code base (optimizing performance for instance). Data evangelism and scrum ceremonies (the stand-ups, retros and alignment with the different stakeholders) will also demand some time that day, but you manage to spark enthusiasm of your achievements so far.



In the late afternoon you have a brainstorming about the plentiful opportunities to automate monitoring and data quality checks for other projects, and to identify a possible implementation of a ML model into production that a data scientist has created. We work on the latest cutting-edge Azure tech-stack.



At the end of the day, as it happens to be Friday, you join the data team for a well-earned drink!

  




**Objectives** **and characteristics** **of the role**

  




As a Data Platform Engineer at MSF, you will be responsible for the Azure-based Central Data Hub (CDH). You’ll be designing and implementing new features for the platform itself, as well as delivering well-architected data pipelines that provide numerous stakeholders with their data. You will further strengthen our CDH, by designing and implementing security measures and managing the CI/CD around the platform, with the aim of rolling out changes as quickly and easily as possible in an automated manner.



You will be part of our journey towards more (advanced) analytics and empowering the MSF-wide movement to do their own reporting and analytics through a Self-Service BI approach.



You are part of the Reporting & Analytics team (6 colleagues) and will work closely together with data management specialists, IT architects, data security and privacy officers and our various stakeholders all across MSF.

  




**Main Responsibilities**

  




* Analyse plans and develop high-level solutions for business applications, workflows and information integration in close collaboration with the different departments of MSF Operational Center Amsterdam (OCA).
* Implement and maintain robust data pipelines that manage and secure the flow of structured and unstructured data from multiple sources towards end-users. This can be data extracted from multiple databases that need to be stored in our central SQL database, or data from a wide array of external sources that can be ingested through API’s.
* You strive for an optimal architecture by taking Microsoft’s Well-Architected Review framework into account (Security, Cost Optimization, Operational Excellence, Performance Efficiency and Reliability) and by working closely together with IT and the Data Security Officer;
* You design and implement new features for the Central Data Hub and are responsible for it to function well and secure
* As we move more towards advanced analytics you help deploying models into production and maintain a continuous integration pipeline, including monitoring and optimizing system performance and cost;
* Since Azure is a rapidly changing world, you will learn and stay up-to-date in the latest tools and services in the Azure ecosystem;
* Follow up with super users to guarantee ongoing support. All done closely together with MSF OCA and International Teams;

  


**Candidate Profile**



Technical skills

  




* You hold a Bachelor's or Master's degree (preferably in Computer Science or similar);
* You have at least 4 years of working experience as a Data (Platform) Engineer, preferably with technologies like Microsoft Azure Data Lake Storage, Azure Data Factory, Azure Databricks, Cosmos DB and Azure SQL Server and/or Synapse Analytics;
* You have experience in at least one of the following areas: setting up cloud-based data pipelines, deploying machine learning models or managing a data infrastructure in the Cloud;
* You have knowledge from Infrastructure as code concepts such ARM, BICEP or Terraform.
* You are familiar with DevOps principles and CI/CD
* You can program in Python

  


Soft skills

  




* You have experience working in Agile/ Scrum teams;
* You are experienced in explaining technical topics to non-technical professionals
* You are service-oriented and demonstrate initiative with a good follow-up attitude;
* Excellent communication skills in English.

  


Nice to have

  




* You have working experience in an international environment, with daily collaboration with and within multicultural groups;
* You are certified in DP-203 (Azure Data Engineer).
* Familiarity with server and serverless solutions, such as containerization, logic apps, batch accounts

  


**We offer**

  




A Dutch employment contract, based on 40 hours per week. It is a one-year contract with a renewal option.



A gross monthly salary in scale 17 with a current salary range between 4,665 and 6,422 euro depending on relevant work experience, based on a fulltime appointment.

  




**Other benefits include:**

  




30 days off (based on a full-time employment)



A premium free pension where MSF covers 100% of the monthly pension contribution



8% holiday allowance, paid out with the salary in May



Commuting allowance (terms and conditions apply) & work from home allowance



Hybrid working is possible (upon prior arrangement)



L&D will support you with a variety of learning and development opportunities with internal and external trainings and courses



An environment that fosters diversity, with colleagues from around the world representing various cultures and background



Discounted daily lunch at the office

  


**Information & application**

  




If you recognise yourself in this profile, we welcome you to apply directly via our website and upload a letter of motivation + Curriculum Vitae (in English) as one combined document.



The closing date for applications is **1****5****th** **of A****ugust** **2024 at 23:59h.**



Please note the application deadline specified above may be subject to extension at MSF-Netherland’s discretion.



The process will consist of two interview rounds.



Please note that only candidates that fully meet the requirements of the position will be taken into consideration.

  




For more information about the recruitment process, please contact Masha Petrovic (Recruiter) at masa.petrovic@amsterdam.msf.org

  




For more infromation about the role and the team, please contact the hiring manager Stephane Chambet-Weil stephane.chambet-weil@amsterdam.msf.org

  


At Médecins Sans Frontières (MSF) / Artsen zonder Grenzen, we are committed to an inclusive culture that encourages and supports the diverse voices of our employees. We encourage applications from individuals of all genders, ages, sexual orientations, nationalities, races, religions, beliefs, disability status, and all other diversity characteristics.

  


 \*\*\*No agencies please\*\*\*

title: Business Data Modeler
description:
Business Data Modeler**At a glance**
---------------


Would you like to help set up Data Products in the new Customer Data Domain, part of Customer Data Solutions? Do you want to be at the forefront of rolling out ABN Amro's data strategy?


Data is one of the key assets of our bank. The bank is rapidly changing to a digital environment and creating a huge amount of relevant data. In this context, we are looking for colleagues who want to contribute to data solutioning, business consulting, data stewardship, or a combination. Are you a team player who wants to be part of an innovative team and loves to help deliver a trustworthy data environment that delivers value, than please reach out (Both NL & EN speakers are welcome).

**Your job**
------------


As a Business Data Modeler in the Customer Data Products team, you will be at the foundation of all data products created within the CDS Data Office. We integrate golden sources into ready-to-use data products for the rest of the organization.


You translate business needs; conduct analysis on various data sources; translate the needs into (requirements for) the conceptual/business data model; use centrally provided data management processes; set up definitions and meta data; define requirements for logical and physical data models; provide input (e.g. parts of the code) for data engineers; review the delivery by the data engineers

**Working environment**
-----------------------

**Customer Data Solutions (CDS)** is the product unit that is end-to-end responsible for generic customer processes and all customer and relationship data (Customer and Party data). This data is made available to all authorized internal stakeholders and external parties via so-called data products. CDS data office consists of 4 teams; BI & Data analytics, Customer & Party Data Products (this role), Data Enablement and Customer & Party Golden Data Team

 **The team Customer & Party Data Products**


We are a new team in development. From early April, we have been responsible for delivering Data Products. We deliver the actual products, help with solving complex data issues related to Customer Data, and act as advisors.

 **The culture**


“You can rely on us!” CDS provides the foundation for many processes within the bank, so it's essential that we show our stakeholders that they can rely on us. We do this in an inclusive work environment where everyone is welcomed

**Your profile**
----------------

* You are a professional with 5+ years of work experience, with at least 2 years in data modelling field
* Knowledge of programming languages such as SQL and Python
* Strong analytic skills and affinity with data analytics, (pre)processing, and data handling
* Excellent understanding of Data Warehouse concepts and data modelling techniques
* Strong and clear communication skills in English (Dutch, French and German are a bonus)
* Experience in working well with multinational teams spread across countries
* Able to perform functional validation, testing and managing stakeholder's expectations;
* You have the skills to challenge your stakeholders and find out the "question behind the question”
* Experience with Analytics and/or Self-Service Business Intelligence and/ or BI tooling (e.g. Power BI, DataBricks);
**We are offering**
-------------------

* The gross monthly salary displayed above is based on a 36-hour work week, including vacation pay and benefit budget.
* The Benefit Budget is 11% of your salary. The Benefit Budget allows you to acquire additional employment benefits. If you make no purchases or reservations in the Benefit Shop in a given month, you are paid one twelfth of your Benefit Budget that month.
* Five weeks of vacation per year. You have the option to purchase an additional four weeks per year.
* Personal development Budget of € 1,000 per year, which you can accumulate up to € 3,000.
* Possibility to work from home, work at least 2 day at the office
* An annual public transport pass with free public transportation throughout the Netherlands.
* An excellent pension scheme.
**Interested?**
---------------


Please reach out to Liesanne Ploeg

**Equal opportunities for all**
-------------------------------


The success of our organisation depends on the quality of our people and the ideas that they have. Truly surprising insights and innovative solutions for our clients result from an interplay of cultures, knowledge and experience. Diversity is therefore extremely important to our organisation. To ensure that everyone at ABN AMRO can develop their talents, we encourage an inclusive culture in which all colleagues feel engaged and appreciated.

**Disclaimer external recruitment agencies**
--------------------------------------------


External recruitment agencies need to have a signed agreement with ABN AMRO BANK N.V., executed by a Talent Acquisition Specialist, when submitting a resume to a vacancy. No unsolicited services or offers, please.

### **Wij vragen**

* Een klantgerichte visie
* Een toekomstgerichte mindset
company_description: Bij ABN AMRO hebben we een duidelijke purpose: Banking for better, for generations to come. Samen met onze klanten gaan we de uitdagingen van onze tijd aan en geven we vorm aan de toekomst.

title: Business Analyst (Personalization track)
description:
**Our client is a leader in the financial services industry, dedicated to leveraging data and technology to enhance customer experiences.** The 'Customer & Data' domain focuses on personalization, fraud prevention, and advanced analytics to drive customer engagement and cross-selling opportunities. The 'Fraud & 1:1 Analytics' area continually evolves to deliver hyper-personalized solutions, ensuring a secure and tailored experience for each customer. Join a dynamic team committed to innovation and excellence in the rapidly changing financial landscape.


We are looking for an IT business analyst with a focus on designing solutions and capabilities on the personalization track within the area of 'Fraud & 1:1 Analytics'.



 The IT Business Analyst is a key player in the cooperation between IT and Business stakeholders. You make complex changes happen within and across tribes (areas) and/or domains (departments). Your holistic view as well as your knowledge and understanding of both Business and IT are crucial in the translation of requirements into features and capabilities. You define and align the roadmaps between squads, tribes and/or domains and thoroughly manage dependencies.



Within the area 'Fraud & 1:1 analytics', residing within the domain Customer & Data, we are always improving our personalisation track, like: hyper personalisation and cross selling. As a IT Business Analyst you will define the improvement journeys and select the right technical capabilities and/or solutions and how to position it within the existing architecture. You will conduct thorough analysis on the (IT) systems, processes and technical dependencies and collaborate with and manage dependencies between squads, tribes, and domains.


**Your key responsibilities:**


* Conduct analysis on the IT application and processes that are in scope of personalisation.
* Translate, analyse, and design new products and services needs into requirements for the IT landscape (blueprint).
* Define and implement detailed, step-by-step plans(roadmaps) on feature level (milestones) and contribute and guide on Epic (project) level together with involved squads, product owners, leads and feature engineers.
* Ensure stakeholders are sufficiently informed to support their decision making and prioritization.
* You guide and challenge the development engineers when making implementation choices.
* Support squads, tribes and domains in prioritizing while ensuring (technical) dependencies are shared and understood.
* You collaborate and reach out across Tribes and functional borders and serve as liaison when needed.
* You will be part of a chapter together with other feature engineers. Within the chapter you will develop your skills, share experiences, and guide or give input on help requests from your peers.

**What do we expect from you:**


* Proficient in English speaking and writing.
* Knowledge and experience in personalization.
* Experience with SAS, bynder, OneCMS or similar
* Excellent communication and report writing skills.
* Superb interpersonal and presentation skills.
* Proven experience in designing, reporting and documenting implementations and solutions.
* Experience in implementing changes in an end-to-end context (covering all functional and non-functional aspects in close collaboration with multiple teams).
* Knowledge of industry best practices and experience with both hardware and software systems.
* Proactive and agile mindset.
* You are a solutionist and opportunist.
* Minimum of 3 years of professional experience in project management, requirements management, process analysis or similar (IT-related) position
* Experience in banking sector is preferred.

**What we offer:**


* Initial 12 month contract assignment with option to extension.
* Hybrid working (on/off-line in the office) 36 hour work week.
* Full pension according to Dutch temp labour CLA.
* Contract to permanent assignment is possible for this vacancy.
* Bandwidth for a fixed term assignement: €5.060,00 - €8.143,00 gross per month
* Holiday pay and 13th month.
* No ZZP/Contractors possible for this role, payrolling is available against a costprice of max €90,00 hourly.
* Relocation services for non-Dutch residents available.

title: Business Intelligence Intern
description:
We are seeking a motivated and analytical Business Intelligence Intern, to join our team in Amsterdam.

  


As a Business Intelligence Intern, you will support our business intelligence efforts by collecting, analysing and interpreting data, to provide actionable insights.

**What we offer**
-----------------

* 2 months of intensive training from our super skilled BI team, on topics like data warehousing, data modelling and Power BI reporting (Data transformation, DAX, report building).
* Followed by 4 months of relevant working experience on a live business case.
* Interact with clients regularly to drive their business towards impactful change.
* Play a key role in the team by creating new business solutions via data-driven insights.
* Receive guidance by a dedicated mentor to make sure you make the most out of your time at Metyis.
* Experience being part of a fast-growing international and diverse team.

**What you will do**
--------------------


* Assist in the design, development and maintenance of BI reporting systems.
* Understand with data warehousing and data modelling activities.
* Participate in the creation of data-driven solutions to support business needs.
* Collaborate with data scientists, business analysts and software engineers to understand and implement reporting requirements.
* Participate in report reviews and providing constructive feedback.
* Stay up to date with the latest developments in all the BI tech stacks and best practices.

**What you’ll bring**
---------------------


* Currently pursuing a Bachelor's or Master's degree in Business Analytics, Data Science, Computer Science, Statistics or a related field.
* Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to derive insights from complex data sets.
* Basic understanding of SQL or BI is helpful.
* Ability to work in a team environment.
* A passion for data analysis and a desire to learn and grow, in the field of business intelligence.

title: Internship: Negotiation Excellence
description:
Job Title
Internship: Negotiation Excellence
Job Description
Start date: September/October 2024
Duration: 6 months minimum
Location: Amsterdam
Hybrid: 2x per week at the office
This internship is not suitable to combine with your thesis due to data sensitivity.  

Have you ever wondered how Game Theory and Mechanism Design are successfully applied in practice? If yes, this is your chance to find out in Procurement within Royal PHILIPS, a leading health technology company focused on improving people's health and enabling better outcomes across the health continuum. Experience how Game Theory and Mechanism Design are applied in practice in procurement within Royal Philips, an innovation leader in Healthcare and Consumer Lifestyle.  

Your Role:* Support the team during the preparation and execution of high impact negotiations in cooperation with Procurement Commodity Managers and Procurement Engineers
* The organization of negotiation trainings and support in the continuous improvement of the training material

  

You are a part of
A small team of negotiation experts within Philips Procurement set up to support commodity managers globally in high-impact negotiations. We are an internal consultancy with an entrepreneurial spirit and the mission to enrich strategic decision-making. We focus on optimizing competitive negotiations while applying Game and Auction Theory, but we are constantly developing new concepts to support all negotiation types end-to-end. We work within cross-functional project teams and analyze & strategize to develop the optimal award mechanism design. In addition to hands-on negotiations, we develop and execute training and coaching programs for Philips Procurement. In short, our activities are a mix of strategy consulting, data analytics, and project management, and the intern will gain deep insights and hands-on experience in an innovative, highly efficient approach to doing business in Procurement.  

You’re the right fit if:
We are looking for interns passionate about continuous learning and challenging the status quo, love solving complex problems and are enthusiastic about Game Theory and negotiations.* Student in Economics, Econometrics, Business Administration, Industrial Engineering, Math, Psychology, or related studies
* Analytical, strategic, and abstract thinking
* Knowledge of negotiations and Microeconomics, including Game Theory and Mechanism Design
* Independent, reliable, and organized way of working
* Great communication skills and MS Office (especially Excel and PowerPoint) skills
* Fluent in oral and written English
* Preferred: Availability for 6 months

  

In return we offer you:* Monthly full-time allowance between €500 - €700 gross, depending on educational level and if you would need to relocate to The Netherlands. If you will perform a part-time internship you will receive the allowance pro-rata.
* Housing compensation, in case of relocating to the vicinity of the office, €300,- net if location is in the vicinity of Amsterdam, €255,- net for all other Philips locations. You need to provide a rental contract of the land lord, and your normal home-work travel distance need to be more than 50 km or travel time (one way trip) need to be more than 1.5 hours.
* Travel compensation, if you are not eligible for a free public transport card; you will receive max. €145,- net
* Paid holidays per internship term.
* The opportunity to buy Philips equipment at our Philips shop

  

IMPORTANT:
Part of our selection procedure is a HireVue online interview recording. We are not able to share the outcome of this HireVue interview but will use this as extra selection criteria.
In order to be considered, you have to be registered as a student during the entire internship period. Formal documentation will be requested. Students from outside the EU enrolled at a Dutch university need to fill in a NUFFIC agreement, or a UNL agreement - which needs to be signed by the student and the university.  

Why should you join Philips?  

Working at Philips is more than a job. It’s a calling to create a healthier society through meaningful work, focused on improving 3 billion lives a year by delivering innovative solutions across the health continuum.
To find out more about what it’s like working for Philips at a personal level, visit the Working at Philips page on our career website, where you can read stories from our employee blog. Once there, you can also learn about our recruitment process, or find answers to some of the frequently asked questions
